-3yjg5ItEzBa0gvifaIMsg.text: Amazing Fish and Chips in London. Traditionally done and inexpensive compared to other top spots. Lovely service and a nice neighborhood atmosphere. The cheese fritters and calimari are a great appetizers to start.The must:Fried HaddockMushy PeasFriesSmothered in Tartar sauce Coca Cola

2LmxAjtgLZ6j0pCRqcTjiQ.text: I have always believed that the U.K. was put on the planet so we'd all know what good fish and chips were supposed to taste like. Over the past few years there has been a great decline of the corner chip shop all over the island. I suspect this is in part to do with the emergence of fast food outlets of a different ilk. McDonald's, KFC, Burger King litter the streets with offerings of cheaper and faster food. It goes like it goes. Having fish & chips in England was the No. 2 item on my list (right behind High Tea) because as a transplanted Scot here in Canada good old fish & chips for me was all about comfort and childhood memories. I searched through the Yelp UK listing hoping to find that 4 - 5 star spot that would sate my lust for this traditional British fare. Let me introduce you to the Golden Hind. For the life of me I cannot figure out where this name came from but what I can tell you is that this is the way fish & chips were meant to be served up. The Golden Hind is located on Marylebone Lane, a back street in a small bistro eating district. Stepping in to this place is like being in a time warp. It is small, seating only about 30, and I'm pretty sure all the fixtures are original. I was home at last! I went straight for the Haddock & Chips with mushy peas, a true, true British tradition and the Golden Hind didn't disappoint. A huge piece of fish, hot & crispy but not "battery" but rather almost just flowered and deep fried, covered the better part of half my plate. It was pure fish manna. The chips were large chunks fried to that bright golden yellow. When we were ordering I asked for a glass of wine (the couple next to us had a bottle on their table) and the waiter/owner told me they weren't licensed. I was really surprised when he said to me that it was a BYOB and that there was a nice little shop just a few doors down that had some decent wine if I wanted to nip down and grab a bottle. Corkage was a mere couple of pounds ($5). I was in shock. Toronto restaurants could take a cue from a place like the Golden Hind. From the minute I stepped in, to the minute I stepped out, there was nary an empty table. That is a testament unto itself. In a city that has a reputation for being one of the most expensive cities in the world, that dinner cost us $35.00 Oh Golden Hind....I miss you already.

itElggYHqPTdcS1rYRwMpA.text: I love this restaurant.the vibe is right, the owner is super kind, and their fish is fresh.the funny thing is that my hubby didn't like fried fish and he ate everything on the plate.. :)

eh34AbRECSGEV0-TyXsTog.text: I thought this place was terrific and I'm only sorry I didn't eat every meal here during my London stay. Fish was perfect: light, nicely battered, perfectly fried. The chips were good: thick and well fried. Prices were a bit high, I thought, but you get a ton of food. And I ate up every single scrap.

ZRhn9SRYN9PKN4Ivk21biQ.text: Went here with a group of four. There was about 20-minute wait, so we went around the block for a pint. There isn't a waiting area here so if it's cold out I'd recommend doing the same! This restaurant was recommended to us for fish and chips and while the menu was basic, there are a variety of fish and you can have it steamed or fried. A tip: alcohol is not served here, but you can bring in your own. We didn't know this and our waiter directed us to a liquor store where we bought a bottle of wine. I would come back and bring visitors. Servers were rushed, but also very friendly.

pUwz-63IctdEwVu2z-E1rw.text: Humongous portion of fish and chips!  Fish was delicious, perfectly cooked, nice batter. Chips were okay, typical French fries, I thought they would be different And a little more cooked.  Otherwise I think this is the place to go if you want the real deal fish and chips in London!  Also, it's BYOB, there is a wine shop right around the corner.

cf12z4GaJCMjxK1n0_2f7Q.text: I shall have a fishy on a little dishy, my peas will be very mushy....okay that is about as far as I can go with this.As far as a fish and chip joint goes this place scores highly, owned by a family who really care about what they cook they have a superb selection of fried fish and classic English desserts.As if thats not enough they also allow BYOB/W/C so you can really make it a proper night out. Don't forget Friday s fish day so make sure you book and ask to sit upstairs.

0vJVjjB236xwbP6OsQ-09g.text: Love Tony's Golden Hind Fish and Chippy  Take all my American friends here and they all love it.  Big portions so we share.  Best Fish and Chip shop in London, always busy.  Tony is the perfect host always friendly and welcoming.

PjlJi_25-C3Wc5-emH3YMw.text: I will be back. Eating here is like eating at home. It's not a fancy place, and the meal doesn't look particularly special, but thinking about it is making my mouth water. Bring your own beer or wine, they will give you cups.The mushy pea made me fart! (worth it tho... )This was our first and last meal in London.

ONgV5WpstV1LLeAQ8V_xWA.text: the fish was pretty tastythe fries (chips) was like a hell and the service was ZERO in compare with States

9QQiged5RClK5yCoADLf6g.text: Awful.... Soggy, Luke warm haddock and the tartare sauce was awful!!! Very surprised at the positive reviews!!

zz7HaBfXQuLS7-2dWxuF3w.text: Simple and friendly. Great fish & chips.Good price. I recommend the plaice.N.b. No liquor license (reason for 4 instead of 5*) but BYO.

fMe1bbPClK_Ln3AwV7_DhQ.text: Just amazing fish and chips.  Fresh fish, golden chips and all at a great price.  That pretty much sums its up.  I know a couple major foodies and they all recommended this place to me.Besides the fish and chips and mushy peas were great.  First time I'd ever tried them but I was impressed.  My girlfriend is now hooked on the stuff.

ZiVAk6mg-UhIDrUulyErfQ.text: We got there at about 12:20 for lunch and JUST beat the crowd on a weekday. I thought the Golden Hind had some seriously good fish and chips. Get the mushy peas and a gherkin and you'll be set. I didn't find the batter to be too greasy so I don't know what all the complaining below is about. Walk off [some] of that grease with a lovely stroll up Marylebone High St. to Regent's Park.Do yourself a favor and just go.

6iYkHPNQJVxmP1tmvu_5KA.text: A great fish and chippy ideal for lunch or dinner. The Greek owners / staff are good people too. My only complaint - they don't open on weekends...oh and they don't serve alcohol - take your own.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

22x9sB0NqLyG9eCUjIk0RQ.text: The golden hind is by far my favorite fish and chips place ever. The first time i went here was on a date in which I had no idea what to expect and was a bit nervous since it was my first dinner date with this fellow. Anyways we arrived at this cute little place that was quite packed. My bf had brought his own wine and they were right on top of it in which they brought out glasses and poured it for us as well. The service was wonderful. I was told by my bf to get the mushy peas... now I'm not a big fan of peas, so i was a bit weirded out when I heard not only are we getting peas but they're gonna be mushy.... wasn't too excited for those, but we'll see what happens. Then the food came out. It was one of the best things I had seen in awhile. The chips were big and perfectly fried, the fish was HUGE and amazingly delicious and I have fallen in Love with mushy peas. I ended up eating almost the whole thing right then and there. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, the service is great and it makes for a wonderful evening. i have been to this place many times now and always bring visitors here as well. It's by far the best fish and chips place in London.

6oLRktxCA802V4wTR_kIQg.text: Another 5-star review and this modest establishment might spontaneously combust.  But what the heck, if they can handle Madonna's late night cravings, they can surely handle another 5-star rave by yours truly. (But only barely, of course.)And here it is folks:Best. Fish and Chips. In London. Trust. An excellent variety of fishy-frying potential along with homemade tartare sauce, huge portions, BYO, and plenty of sides and apps to keep even the pickiest eaters satisfied, it's no wonder the walls are adorned with signed celebrity photos. (I'm expecting a call any day now.)

7OrClJd1jIUJGon_crsAtQ.text: Ok, I'm going to have to make an effort to write some bad reviews now! - but not till I've written this one...Fish and chips - an old traditional treat for the British, along with bangers and mash, egg and chips, beans on toast - etc etc - But you try so hard to find a good fish and chip shop, then you'll stay with it for years, and never leave....Well this fish and chip shop is just that good enough - the best fish and chips in London, believe me, ive tried the rest - theres bad, good and brilliant - but this....its amazing!  As it's a friday, go there tonight!

GKuQnbyWrF9mjenUlcUo1A.text: Great place for fish & chips if you are in the area, freshly cooked. It's over 100 years old. Only down side was when I wanted take out at lunch (used to work close by), they did not do just chips take away, always had to get something else..... other than that, great, especially as it BYO! Recommend!

noefH128-tAyjSONHbw9lg.text: Based on the Yelp review, I had to try this place. The fish and chips were delicious. The fish (had haddock and cod) were extremely fresh; I don't think it could have been any fresher... The only thing that bothered me was the amount of grease... I know, it's deep fried and is supposed to be greasy.. but man.... my entire plated was DRENCHED in grease! This place is also very small, probably about 20 seatings, max. If you don't mind eating super greasy food, try it! The chips are off the hook!!!

_vuFbeQiWz9N_z-XQ0_eYQ.text: Good fish and chips. Reasonable prices.  Clean.  Interesting that the fish and chips are ordered separately.

lW3MQ33wdAu1yxDiuSKE1Q.text: Quite literally the best fish and chips (and mushy peas, yes the legendary status is deserved!) I've had. In and out of London! I always try and sit in the old bit (to the right) because I prefer the atmosphere but its lighter in the extension. The staff are friendly, the owner is lovely and the food is delicious... what more do you want! The portions are super generous and reasonably priced as well. Perfect! No alcohol is served though but you can bring your own, plus theres a Tesco aroud the corner or a Majestic opposite that!

5dgegjX0hfRtcNjt35KpLg.text: I went here for dinner. This place has great fish and chips. The battered fish is nice and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. I liked how the fish wasn't oily. The chips were also good. I thought the portion size is large. This place gets super crowded so get here early or you could end up waiting for a table. The service was great.

rfv2E-VFm-p9PmZdQWQCsw.text: Fish & Chips!  We chose cod and it was lightly battered and not too oily.  Generous portions and fair prices.  Highly recommend.

f0jkaSyPcOJr4fw9DTRn6g.text: Wonderful fish and chips. Just what we wanted on our London trip. Ambience is not much but The Golden Hind is worth seeking out. Neighborhood is interesting, too

Na8qo2zfSIR4eTvFIdIuEQ.text: I've been meaning to write a review for a long, long time. This place is always floating in my memories of London.The fish and chips here is "whoa" - aka. it will blow your mind away!! They get their ingredients fresh early in the morning, so the stocks are fluctuating all the time I guess, so be careful if you're dining in late, they might run out.But unusually strange I have to admit, the smashed peas just takes me away, No one ever really compliments the appetizers/condiments, but this is a must if you're hitting up this place.And Tony, the owner of the store, he is a really sweet guy, and definitely shows that he wants the best for his customers. 1X8hJ1QuKknbeFZ9a-vZcQ.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant. As the other reviewers posted, the portions are very large and definitely shareable. We had the cod fish which was very tasty. We had the calamari to start, which we wouldn't recommend. Also, the BYOB is great, especially with the Tesco down the street. As fish and chips shops go, we would highly recommend.

nj0Ru3ETko5h9OzNxQHqiQ.text: One of the rare times that I've been lead astray by Yelp. While I'm not British, I have had my share of fish & chips. What I had at the Golden Hind was worse than what I've had at Long John Silvers...and I didn't think that was possible! The batter lacked flavor as did the mushy peas. The chips were very pale & limp and the vinegar tasted watered down. 8Y_ZMJEcQ1P9XDW3sNY2YQ.text: Simply the best fish & chips in London! Nice family atmosphere, great service and super cod. The fish was fresh and super crunchy, the chips were fine. Interesting fact, you can bring your own wine bottle ;)You definitely have to try the place!

4IYxKN2J40wtJEdOJLHeJQ.text: This is one of my shortest review, just to say that this is a simple place, no fuss, no thrills, but you'll get great fish and chips :-)The fish is of good quality, the batter is good, the chips are nice thick chips, and service is efficient :-)Nothing else to add :-)

LK5i42KHgj93Djgs89153A.text: Can't help but give it five stars based on it delivering on exactly what you would expect - a great fish & chips spot.  I had the fried cod with chips and a Greek salad. Fish was great and great fresh salad. I also had the ginger beer that was recommended. All delivered and it was clearly a family owned place with the family members working there. Great service on top of it all.

JcGn9xb8dgIV-pSoAyzN9Q.text: Recommended by an AUTHENTIC British person as the BEST fish & Chips in London!My lovely British friend made me promise to swing by this place, and I am glad I did. 7sGSLzsZmJNSY4S6QhAkpg.text: The fish and chips is the best I have ever tasted before! Their place looks a little bit traditional, but their food is delicious. It is a recommended place to visit in London!

cyuRXGkXNQEBGFpcPciP-g.text: Fish and chips the way it was meant to be made.  A large crispy coating, and fries deep fried to perfection.  If you are looking for this classic dish, you will not find a better place than the Golden Hind.

8xKvpXmRq5F6xLldjDZuOw.text: You may notice on my profile that I love fish and chips.  You may also notice that this restaurant gets 5 stars.By far the best fish & chips I have had in London. They have a wider selection of fish than usual to order and are impeccably fresh and are never, ever frozen.And the mushy peas -- did I mention the mushy peas yet?  Vibrantly green, unbelievably delicious. Mushy peas are typically left on the plate at other venues, yet are the first to go at the Golden Hind.The venue itself has expanded in the past year  to accomodate the large crowds. The owner remembers me whenever I come back and am always promptly seated.  Of course, if you arrive at 8pm on a Friday night, you can expect a queue, but it is well worth the wait.And of course, it is BYO, but that is no worry. I have brought wine which they quickly set up glasses and popped the bottle for me. I have brought beer to which they brought pint glasses to pour into. I have brought nothing and they pointed me to the nearest liquor shop across the street upon my query.If you're ever around Oxford St and are feeling peckish, you would be delighted to step in and rediscover fish and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

FIgbvywpelPVCG0tgHgEHw.text: Kind a diner for just fish and chips.  Simple menu.  I had the fried cod cakes with tarter and cocktail sauce.  Nice.  The real star was the gigantic piece of deep fried, battered cod with chip.  Really well cooked, not greasy.  The portion was so big, I chose to pass on what looked some really tasty desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Deep fried battered cod with chips and mushy peas....yummy...
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fried codcakes with tarter and cocktail sauce...solid.

esGJc1vqMbKAN_9OsEfVIg.text: Huge cod filets, delicious.  Can be busy, but even when there's a line it moves quickly.  BYOB, but try the ginger beer, it's Old Jamaica brand and it's fantastic.The owner walks around and is very kind and hospitable.  Great experience.

9MpxZ8tfEyEq-e43q1otjg.text: The first place I ate in London to get a good English meal. Went for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprised. With all the notions of English food not being tasty and London being expensive, this place did its best to nix these notions. I had a large portion of the fish and chips with mushy peas and and a dessert of treacle tart. The entree food was amazing and probably the best version of fish and chips I had in London and was cheap considering theLarge portion sizes. The dessert was alright but I tend to like sweeter items so itMay have just been me. On top of the great food, the service was also great as we had a very friendly waiter and even took a picture with him to document our first meal in London. Definitely a must to get ur classic English food!

RzbtdXzVZdbUMM64Z3evsw.text: Fantastic, massive fish with delightfully crispy coating and moist, flaky interior. Great chips and mushy peas on the side - extra. So, the food quality is good, and the service was just fine. A couple of gripes - beer and wine would be a great addition to the menu.  The lighting in the new annex to the left as you walk in is way too bright. The lack of music makes the ambiance downright awkward - everyone was speaking in hushed tones, you thought you were in a doctor's waiting room. Also, the ice cream was a bit freezer burnt. However, all of these gripes can be overlooked because the place is BYOB (I wish I had known that before) and the fish & chips are legendary.

TEHn3Wy4PfXEC-tF-RL5VA.text: Decent portion size and price. Very good quality fish and chips. I am not surprised that the Golden Hind has been so highly reviewed.

Iykp9itqDnMyoCnJlx8raQ.text: We wanted a great fish and chips place and after a little research we decided to venture up to this neighborhood to try The Golden Hind. It was definitely worth it. My bf and I each had a plate of fish and chips and together with some beer bought from the Tesco nearby (it's BYOB) we happily stuffed ourselves. I had the haddock and my bf had cod. The fish is fresh and the batter is very light so it doesn't feel greasy or heavy. The portions are quite big but I managed to eat it all. I'm definitely glad we had fish and chips here instead of all the other touristy places in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

wT4_XajeP86yb_Mp-3_GvQ.text: Summary: GREAT fish n chips, good desserts, mediocre appetizers/starters. One of the better fish n chips in the areaThe Place: The restaurant is larger than you'd expect from the pictures. It has a large main dining area and a basement that serves as a private room for larger parties/events. The dining atmosphere looks nice and is decorated well, but is still a casual atmosphere. The atmosphere isn't the main attraction here, but it is a nice place. The service was great, very attentive, quick, and friendly.The Food: Let's start with the starters...they were somewhat small and we shared most of them to sample as many as possible. The calimari was stringy but tasty, and had a perfectly golden crusted fried coating. The fish cakes were somewhat mushy, but had a good flavor even though not visually stunning. The fried feta looked delicious, but the strong flavor of feta was a bit overwhelming inside the lightly fried crust.The main course, Haddock and chips, was absolutely delicious. It was perfectly cooked, and had a harder fried crust than many fish n chips I've had in the US. The fries were hit or miss, with an occasional soggy few. This is one of the better fish n chips I've had, and the portions were gigantic. Especially after having a starter, it's difficult to finish the fish n chips here.The desserts were all incredible, we again ordered one of each to sample them all. The sponge cakes were delicious, most notably the chocolate sponge cake with ice cream. The bread pudding was soggy and not as flavor packed, but all of the other desserts were delicious. By far, the best one was the chocolate sponge.The Value: The fish and chips came out around 10-13 pounds, and desserts and starters were around 3-5 pounds. The main course is absolutely worth it, and you get large portions and a great value for such a delicious plate. The appetizers were not worth the price for their lower quality and smaller portion sizes. The desserts were all delicious, but somewhat pricey as well, so I'd suggest getting one or two for the table to share.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. All of the desserts
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. All of the desserts
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate Sponge

-dB-Scuar-68FVB6T3s20Q.text: I fear fish-and-chips is in the category of steak: there's only so good it can be.In its essence, there are very few variables, and while that limits the downside, that also limits the upside.Compare to a sandwich: there are trillions of combinations of all the inputs, so the final output can be quite varied, and you can be delighted or disappointed...dazzled or disgusted. Fish and chips, like steak, has few inputs. Once you're at the level where you're using good quality fish, fresh hot oil, and a consistent batter, then you've sort of hit your ceiling. The food here was quite good, to be sure, but because this is the best reviewed place, and all the Elites are saying 'best i've ever had.' one cannot help but be slightly disappointed at the fact that, at its essence, it's still a deep fried whitefish. And even in it's best form (which this might be), it lacks the complexity and flavor of a panko coated dijon salmon, or a sesame seared ahi.The chips were interesting: crisp on the outside; soft and dense on the inside. But again: lacking the seasoning of steak fries and the crispness of frites.Great, friendly, and efficient service.

bHpmm0l7JkNpJdScjexEMg.text: The best fish and chips ever.  Traveled to London for 3 days and i hoped we could find a good F N C place to refresh the good old days.  Great food.  They were celebrating their 100 years.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Yamm fish and chips

QmVVrQbTyOvyEnkvuMXGsQ.text: This is definitely the best fish and chips in London. It's an intimate, long established restaurant in Marylebone. The menu is simple and the food is tasty. Try it.

OPAidfUyiIxVxuu0VexcMg.text: Pretty much the best fish and chips, ever.  Crunchy, not overly greasy, yummy fish.  And the mushy peas were great.  It was super busy, but really a great place.

4E2ZbbpxJj0UNwz5iMFe0Q.text: I came to London in February hoping to enjoy the Fish and Chips at the Golden Hind. I was sort of disappointed and thought that perhaps I need to re-visit what great Fish and Chips really are. Here are my qualifications:-A CRISPY batter that is golden and will nearly break your teeth upon crunching down on it (of course, I exaggerate, but I want it crispy!). No soggy batter lurking on the inside.-Fresh soft fish.-Golden, fluffy chips that are crispy on the outside but not so much that they can't absorb a generous amount of malt vinegar.Someone mentioned earlier that the Golden Hind's service was joyless. I also found this to be the case. They were certainly not welcoming and although they had many tables without a reserved sign, they questioned everyone who came through the door if they had a reservation and then wandered over to closely placed tables and squished everyone in. I can appreciate that they are busy and have to seat the reservations, but come on-- a reservation for Fish and Chips? I agree as well, with another poster, who said that his local pub has better Fish and Chips. And at the pub, the chips and peas are included in the price.The fish was, indeed, fresh. Honestly though?If I have a great piece of fish, I'm not going to cover it in batter and deep fry it. I'll sautee and roast it with lemon and capers. As long as it's not reeking-- serve it up for fish fry! Overall, I would say the flavour was just okay. My bill, for for a large Cod with Chips and peas was over 15 pounds! The pub is way cheaper and much better.Sorry, Golden Hind, But you're lacking in environment, value and a few other things that might lead me to rave about your place.Next time I'm in London, I'll stick to the pub and a pint.

Qj-U6MjKi6MWKnfS7dmNcQ.text: I visited London for a few days and was expecting some great fish and chips. This place did not disappoint. The cod I had was very good. To me, the highlight was the tartar source. I had never paid much attention to the tartar source, that's before visiting this place. The tartar source simply made the fish more tasty without overpowering the fish. I am not giving a 5 star because one of the appetizers was sold out, which left me wondering if I had miss something amazing.

CuyaZ0oT6paEs2XbE1DcDA.text: Will make this one short and sweet. Very good fish and chips by any standards. Americans love salt, fat and grease, so when you read callous reviews that London food sucks - they mean add salt, fat and grease.Excellent fish. I had the haddock fried with chips, man had the cod fried with chips and we shared a side of mushy peas. The breading wasn't greasy at all. In fact, it was dry, light with just the right crunch. The fish was moist and flaked off easily with the slightest touch of the fork. I recommend a heavy hand with the malt vinegar. Yum. Huge portions for roughly £11 each. The side of mushy peas for under £3 was divine. I could have had another full order on my own.Very sweet staff and mixed clientele of devoted locals and tourists (with European accents). We had a table overlooking a trendy French restaurant across the street and  laughed at the line that was wrapped around the building and down the street. We checked it out and learned it was voted Trip Advisor's top pick for 2012, however, it's numbered rating was further down the line than The Golden Hind. So, ha! Highly recommend! Great value per London standards. BYOB, which we didn't know beforehand. Again, if you are looking for salt, fat and grease, McDonald's offers a hockey puck (I mean filet o fish) to nosh on.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fried haddock and fried cod with a side of mushy peas. Yum!

ViaLBlDtphus3LTj2H0BPQ.text: This was by far the best fish and chip place that we found in London! The breading is not too heavy and the fish is nicely cooked. I had the Cod and my husband had the Haddock. We both agreed that the Cod tasted better. The Chips were a pretty good, although I would have liked them to be a little crispier.

X5B6A5Ytg0RGpKYCXO6VGg.text: A massive fillet of perfectly battered haddock, some decent chips, and a whole mess of mushy peas for a mere £10 including tip? That's truly inspired.If not for the fact that my fish fry was already starting to lose its crispness by the time I finished it, I'd suggest that this is actually enough food for two meals. Then again, doggie bags aren't really the done thing here, and even mushier chips don't sound so appealing.For no frills and no nonsense British fried food, this is a fine find. I do wish it were slightly less convenient to my office; the temptation has me worried for my figure!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Small haddock, chips, mushy peas

guppagQWWEJ5QEnKKScKRg.text: Delicious fish and chips never disappoints great ginger beer super awesome atmosphere and to boot very inexpensive A+ winner

E6MqDBHA5yWCF4ZJEzvRAg.text: SWEET BABY JESUS!!!  This place makes fish and chips an art that must be taken in if you're in London. Very walkable from Baker street and worth every step.We had the cod, chips and mushy peas on one visit. And added in salad and shrimp cocktail on the second (can skip the shrimp).  All of it was great. Service is excellent and the ambience is what you'd expect for a fish and chips place. Prices are very reasonable too.

wDHH6cbwNkM-xxFex-vV0Q.text: My first review of 2015 goes to The Golden Hind. It was the best fish and chips I have ever tasted. It was a Tuesday night and we were the first to arrive at 7 PM, greeted by the very friendly owner himself. We chatted a bit and as soon as we told him we are Canadian, he stepped into his kitchen and came out with a picture of himself with Stephen Harper. Apparently Harper dined at The Golden Hind just six months ago, and a lot of Air Canada crew members frequently dine here as well. While waiting for our food, we also noticed a lot of locals were popping in and out to order take-out. That's when you know this place is good. We ordered cod and haddock, with salad and a side of gherkin (pickled cucumber). It seems like they used to give the option of a large or small portion for the fish, but now, there's only one size to choose from and the portions are big! The fish was very fresh, tasty, and so crispy... I hope I can eventually find fish and chips in Toronto that is just as good as The Golden Hind.Simply put...friendly staff, filled with locals, simple menu, decent prices, big portions, and very delicious fish and chips. I will definitely be back next time I am in London!

mxxSFl8dRMFsGKZsN87WgA.text: Oh, it was good. So very good. Five-star fish and chips. Family-operated (with a plaque on the wall showing the history going back to 1914!!), the fish was fresh and yummy and flaky and light and delicious! My uncle has a thing about his food and his chips being extra hot, he always asks that the plate be hot (and if he's having chips, that they are extra hot) whenever he dines out. Sadly, this was overlooked by the waiter. A little while later, the owner came by and it was mentioned - he immediately brought us a fresh bowl of insanely hot chips.As mentioned elsewhere, this restaurant does not have a liquor or beer license (too much hassle, I am told), but they have no problem with BYOB and in fact are quite happy to return glasses to the pub on the corner. Bonus!This is a very small restaurant and they tend to not take reservations, so expect a wait. And expect that people may well be standing and waiting right next to your table while you're eating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. The restaurant's history

8N2jdCEnJP3Q-gmFM6NC3w.text: Crackin' good time at The Golden Hind. Arrived around 7pm on a Friday night. There was a pretty good line, but we ended waiting no more than 20 minutes to get a table. The menu covers the normal array of fish offerings. We opted for one order of cod and one order of halibut (steak). The portions were very generous. More than we could eat. The cod had a good crust on it and was light and flaky. The halibut was a thick cut with a good fishy taste. Perhaps not the fish for everyone. We loved it! The chips were crisp and plentiful. One quick note - the place is BYOB. Don't think I knew that before we arrived.N&joy

fMuWWdrVFNfslSXmtGxWfg.text: After going through the reviews - I decided to give them a try. I was able to get to the restaurant a little after 6PM, when they open for dinner and the place was already quite full. I was able to get a seat quickly and the menu is truly quite simple. I ordered the basic to try (also as a standard, when I try other places): Cod & Chips. (By the way, they no longer have the prawn in garlic sauce in starters section). The servers were friendly, efficient, and the order came quickly. And I have to say, I'm a fan. The fish is done really well and without all the extra oil that can make me sick. The portions are decently large - I can finish it all but I'm stuffed in the end. I'm in no way a fish and chips expert, especially since there are so many fish and chips restaurant in London, but after trying Golden Hind, its a place I would recommend to my friends and a place I would go back again. So I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good fish & chip place in London.

S18DMBmQmAXsOWL2fjDjxA.text: This was the crispiest fish I've ever had.  The fish inside was tender and simply delicious.  The portion was large and I enjoyed all of it.  I did use some of the "tartar sauce" provided.  I also tried the malt vinegar on the chips and fish.  The chips were just okay but tasted nice with the ketchup (forgive me).  The place was busy on a Saturday evening around 6.  We had tried to go for lunch but they were not open for lunch on a Saturday.  The staff wanted to know where we were from.  The owner was friendly.  Large groups started to come in with their own alchohol.  I heard one woman leave and say it was the best fish and chips that she had ever had.  I saw what looked like Greek salads being served around me, they looked good.We are also patrons of the steak frites place across the street and my dream meal would be to have the fish with the frites from L'Entrecote....

28dPGzR-mbLtiD-FNMgjKw.text: My wife and I were visiting London for a few days and were looking for some proper fish & chips. This place satisfied our craving. It took us a few minutes to find it, but it seemed like a fun neighborhood. I had the Haddock and my wife had the Cod. I thought the Cod was better, although both were great. It is bring your own wine, which we didn't know before but seemed like a great idea. Was a great experience.

PK7rKLCZXFSjrNE8u0MlmA.text: Very busy and popular  place. Unfortunately got seated from the downstairs, which was not a right move at all.. So, stay upstairs and maybe bring your own bottle. Service was slightly exhausted. Fish&chips a must when in London!

PDmrdOaxB4yrf-fvC6H9hQ.text: We tried the Golden Hind after I'd done a search on Yelp prior to our trip to London.  I wanted to find authentic fish and chips and the Hind was among the highest rated.   The place was absolutely packed, as expected, so we sat at an available table in the small room downstairs, which was also full.Before our visit to the Hind, we'd stumbled upon a pub in Westminster called The Old Star, where we'd ordered fish and chips.  Having that advance frame of reference may have sullied our opinion of the Golden Hind's fish because we actually liked the batter and overall flavor of The Old Star's better.  While the Golden Hind's fish was good overall, our absolute favorite items were the mushy peas and the Spotted Dick for dessert.   Overall a good experience and glad to have heard about it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Mushy peas are the best!

LGglVdbAIX8EFP36Kvblbw.text: Great service. The fried fish and chips are good. Has the smashed peas and liked them.  The chocolate sponge cake with custard was great.

KPKtZlAIZmHm12myQKjxsA.text: We had our first meal in London at The Golden Hind. We had put it in into our itinerary after reading the great reviews. It did not disappoint. We tried the fish, chips and the mushy peas. The fish tasted fresh. The fries were crispy and the peas tasty. The service was attentive even though we were one of the last customers to walk in just before closing time. We also had the cute bottles of Coca Cola. It was a nice meal. The price was good.  I would return to this place if I visit London again. It's worth another visit.

wDCmS0jEllTds7rg3AJG7Q.text: Took a little time to find the place, but glad we did. Staff, super nice. We had 5 people eating and they quickly pulled us a bunch of tables together. All of us American, wanted ice for our coke, they ran out and got it.  I had the small haddock, chips and mushy peas. Fish was bigger than my hand, a tasted fantastic!! chips and mushy pea, ok. Tarter sauce also excellent!

bxuLxLETOBR6BN_qpmV-ug.text: I love my fish and chips. Coming to London, i was excited and was expecting awesome fish n chips to be found everywhere, Be it newspaper wrapped or served on a fancy plate. Sadly, it seems that what London has to offer is quite elusive. I was told that to find a good one, it will have to be outside of London. That is until I heard of The Golden Hind which came recommended. That got me quite excited and I happily roped in some friends for dinner there. Watching food passing you with its aroma enticing was too much while we waited for a late party to arrive. We decided to order some starters to tide our tummies over.  Feta cheese fritters £3.4Whole tail scampi £3.6Interesting fried little bites. I like the crispy batter and both were tasty without being greasy. Fish and chipsWith some of us trying to be healthy, there were mixed orders of grilled fish and fried fish in the fish and chips order. The fish and chips are decent and of a good standard. They don't beat this in Whitby but as far as London goes, this will be one of the places that comes to mind when craving fish and chips.

dZ0WtDm3zHdP8otk8dV4Qg.text: I spent probably a decade avoiding all forms of fried food...and yet, I keep ordering fish and chips now that I'm living in London. It's just so satisfying a meal!The mushy peas here are extra green..which i'm guessing means extra fresh? Good stuff. And there's a great selection of types of fish with the additional option of having it steamed rather than battered and fried. Only thing that was weird was that the place is really brightly lit like an american diner, yet the tables, waiters, arrangement of the space looked like it was trying to be something fancier. Tables were a bit too close together, too, to the point that it was difficult for my beau to find room to stash his violin without tripping a waiter or putting it partially under the feet of people at another table.

hmdg83h9Hw-545E-sEE7Fg.text: Simple. No fuss. And original. These are the words that come to my mind when I think of the place. Such places that are slightly "rough around the edges" make me feel like I have stumbled upon a "local hangout". Fish and chips were fabulous, especially the chips. We also ordered feta cheese fritters and mushy peas. All really tasty. It's just a 10 min walk from oxford street.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish and chip

Jbm1l50u3BMSk0EpuBZndw.text: Hung over. Morning meeting in Marylebone. Asked the client if the chip shop in Lisson Grove was still good. He said it was but directed me to the Golden Hind instead. Nice call. Me and planner foodie bowl in. Packed but there's a table free and we grab it. The place is full of regulars it feels to us. Lots of old kooky looking people who live around the area engaging the owners in bizarre conversation. The surroundings are sparse, a few historical pictures on the wall. It's functional. But that's the beauty. They have a sign on the wall there which informs you who the owners have been since the place started nearly 100 years ago. Three Italian families and two Greek. The place is buzzing. We order 2 cod and chips and I get a cup of tea. Gav orders bread and butter too. Proper.The dish that came out was excellent. Large cod was battered thinly and crisply and was as close to perfect as you could want. Chips were slightly underdone I thought and there were probably a few less than I would have liked but the fish was big and I'm just greedy. Accompanying tartare sauce was excellent and complimentary. The tea was just how I ordered. Strong. Not much milk. Hangover not cured but certainly massaged. This place is a must. The whole area is fascinating and worth a wonder round and this place is full of history, provides a warm welcome and furnishes you with the most excellent fish and chips. Eat in for a tenner. Can't say fairer. The full five stars.

B5j64gliMmVnLw1BR3adAA.text: small shop front but they have a basement dining area for bigger groups.batter was crispy enough but rather bland in taste.fish though fresh was also rather bland in taste.we tried their cod and also the skate wing.chips were dry and again bland tasting.i guess that's what the salt and vinegar is for?this place can get really crowded and the tables and seats are rather squashed together.together with the oily, smoky air, the ambience might just put you off a bit.as for me, i think i've experienced better in more pleasant environment.

NYXWuOmWt-OHcQB-rAxT7Q.text: How can anyone NOT love the Golden Hind? Ok, it's not the sort of place you want to take your visiting great-aunt for a nice sit-down meal.Cons (only because I have to exhibit some semblance of balance): the starters are relatively poor in taste / quality but skip these for a perfect fish & chips mealPros (so many!): Love the waitstaff  so warm and jovial, love the fish, BYOB (with a Nicolas conveniently located around the corner), cheap cheap cheap.Pop in all the time, especially when I can't deal with the queue at Relais across the street and opt for fish instead of steak.

1anCFsjhtUuxCXcSYeouvw.text: On our last night in London a few weeks ago, we wanted to find a great fish n chips spot that was affordable, great tasting and fun.  The Golden Hind satisfied us (my 10 year old son as well as my 70ish year old parents) in every way, and I could not recommend it more highly.  Other Yelpers were spot on - the proprietor (who is from Cyprus, not Greece he told us!) was welcoming, informative and warm.  The fish was fantastic, with a light, crispy batter and wonderful fresh taste.  The best we sampled during our visit.  Price was very affordable, and the cozy, unpretentiously trendy neighborhood added a nice touch.  This is a must stop when you are in London!  Thanks for making our last night so enjoyable!

kwYZYMdVYS1RLzEoWihywA.text: During his stay here, my beau desperately wanted to try some authentic fish and chips. We did our research, and this ended up on many short lists that we read. So, exploring we went. We got there and it was extremely packed. Then again, it was 6 PM on a Friday. Not shocked. They seated us in the basement, and we were promptly served. Sadly, the ladies next to us were infuriated because they weren't served for a half hour after they ordered. Pity. Food-wise, we ordered the fried feta for starters. Heavenly, and should replace mozzerella sticks as a normal appetizer. Then, since I wanted to be slightly healthy, I got steamed cod and garden peas (no worries, I've had normal fish and chips before. Didn't want anymore friendness, though). Still a really delicious dish. All and all, it was a hit for the both of us. While I didn't pay, the beau said it was a cheap bill. So, extra points there!

Gg7AIuypb4Uz6K4nGAj3hQ.text: The fish is fresh and it is not too oily, however I had better when I was in Gibraltar. The chips are cut thick and the mushy peas are quite good.

sKvKaoRa527VClYCQIA3Tw.text: It's not normal fish and chips. So many people from all over the world come here to have fish and chips. Yes, it's pricy as fish and chips but you pay tenner with great quality of traditional british! You should experience once.

dcfZUrPfxS6nI9c_GLZ0mw.text: We had a very nice dinner here especially due to the kindness of the manager. Entirely due to our own miscalculation we arrived very late but they accommodated us anyways.  The food turned out to be very good and we enjoyed it without feeling rushed. Yes, it is hard to find. Once you get there there may be a line as well. Take away orders can be quickly accommodated though.

mPIs4Dcb8ukXGcUE_jjNkw.text: on business. last night in London before a morning flight home. Very tired and hungry. Walk in to busy busy place staff very friendly Hoddock and chips and mushy peas please I ask. And boy did they deliver. Fish was wonderfully fresh, not greasy. Peas were pure comfort. Chips were the only downside but who cares. With all the hustle bustle going on in there staff still had time to joke a bit. All sorts from regulars to tourists to suits like me. and 12 pounds before tip!Perfect. Yummy.

KlJUoeJaO7zhivbLm3wsPg.text: I just visited The Golden Hind once again last night, and the service was horrible. I know they were busy, but i was pretty bad, we constantly had to flag down our waiter....and even then sometimes they were too busy to help us. Food and ambiance are always lovely, and I do love this restaurant, but just a heads up not to expect quality service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

UGJ6wJrP72cvLcECQ47FwA.text: I have to say, I was disappointed.What with all the 4- and 5-star love that Golden Hind gets here and its 'Hot on Yelp' status, I thought I was about to eat the Fried Fish of Destiny when the server plaiced (heh) my plate down in front of me.But it was not to be.  I cannot even say that it was merely 'good', that's how disappointing it was.  The fish inside the fried batter was perfectly cooked, sure.  It was moist and juicy and flaked apart easily with my fork.  But you and I know that plain, unseasoned cod - despite being perfectly cooked - is perfectly tasteless on its own.  The batter!  The batter is what makes it tasty.  But the batter around my cod was like a fish-and-chips black hole of taste.  It tasted like nothing!  Fried nothing.  I tried drowning it in salt. Still didn't taste of anything. I tried dousing it with vinegar.  Still didn't taste of anything.I tried eating it with ketchup.It only tasted vaguely of ketchup.How is this possible?  It defies the laws of physics and chippies.  Plus, the chips were kind of dry.Take it from me, the Golden Hind is NOT the best fish and chips you'll ever have.  Hell, it's not even the best fish and chips you'll ever have in London (which is a city not known for having good fish and chips in the first place).

jjfBOrOfdMlsrrrjVWrrLA.text: The Golden Hiney. So much has been said about it on Yelp, I felt that I really needed to see what all the fuss was about! And you know what? I still don't know!I guess The Golden Hind must be very highly rated in a lot of American restaurant guides of Foggy London Town... While eating here, it had the same vibe as The House Of Nanking in San Francisco - "I am here with a load of other people that are eating food that a book/website told them was the best, therefore they CAN NOT disagree".However: *I do have my own tastebuds, many of them in fact.*I have a watch. I can tell that I waited nigh on an hour for a table. In the rain.*I have eaten fried fish before. I can notice that it was not as chunky and white as many other restaurants.*I found it to be a pain to 'bring my own bottle'. We were in Marylebone not Macclesfield.In the defence of The Golden Hind, I can say that the fish was fresh and the oil that it was cooked in was clean. However, this must be down to the fact that out of neccessity, they must change the oil frequently, so by extention, great tasting F&C's is helped MASSIVELY by high footfall and fresh ingredients. Well, the two highlights of my time there were - 1) Seeing Bill Nighy in there.2) My friend balancing a full glass of red wine on the back of my hand while I was sending a text. Guess what? It fell off.All in all - great tasting food, but for the money, I have had way better.

l0JHxmGyikLQ-JllIKeJdw.text: We were referred here by our hotel concierge and we are so happy we took him up on this suggestion. We walked there, which was a great choice because the street is beautiful! The menu is quite small, but there specialty is fish & chips. We ordered 2 orders of fish & chips. The chips were thick cut fries and delicious. The fish was very fresh!

unMHXJAFHMrumuCtZ2A0-A.text: They are no longer BYOB they changed their policy less than a month ago and we had already opened a beer and got harassed by the staff their new policy is less than two weeks old and they are scolding their customers multiple times I got the message on the first pass the three more reminders was just plane rude the fish is still good but byob was part of the charm will not be back wish they never changed

-l40rrKVuHTMlVrywLo3Kg.text: This was the most reviewed fish and chips spot in London. So on my very first day I arrived, sickened from jet lag and light rain, I decided to trek here on my own. Not too far, and not to expensive. I ordered takeaway and ate it nearby at Cavendish Gardens. I ordered - small battered cod and small chipsIT WAS MASSIVE. It lasted me for two servings. I really enjoyed the tartar sauce, but the fish and chips lacked some seasoning. Thankfully, I sprinkled some pepper before I left and brought some salt packets. YAY! After that, the fish was pretty delish! It was oily (as expected) and very hearty. All in all, solid place. Take this review with a grain of salt (as you will need it with the fish) since I've never had fish and chips elsewhere so I have no comparison. Cheerio!

SHhLOvfgZGHCFjbsa8zYFQ.text: Fish & Chips is a must try while you're in London. Luckily my friend who lived in London is a foodie and had tried out every fish & chip place you could think of - & recommended that we go to The Golden Hind.Now this place doesn't open till like 6P or something like that, and there is usually a wait. Also, this place gets packed - super fast - probably because it's one of the most popular places to eat F&C. Mom & Pop shop vibe.I ordered that standard with a side of mushy peas which were pretty tasty! The bill was a bit large, but I learned that you pay a pretty penny for everything in London, so  you really can't avoid something being expensive.Portion is pretty big too, very filling. Definitely check this place out next time you're in London!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips with mushy peas!

m68rOVvUdt7-9V9xO75n7g.text: Finally a fish n' chips place that lives up to its hype. The haddock and cod are indistinguishable as usual, but the batter is nicely done.Skip the fries and mushy peas. These are mere distractions on your road to fried fish.Service is speedy considering how they don't fry the fish until you order.Much cheaper to get your food for takeaway, but beware of how the parks in West London are gated and private (boooo), but Hyde Park isn't all that far. We just gave up getting to the grass itself and ate it under the Marble Arch amidst pigeon poos.

fu9j1hDb77FXgoWfDPb__Q.text: This is a easy cheap and cheerful BYO restaurant. The offering is simple: fish- fried or steamed, plus what ever sides you want. The servings are big and the fish is pretty delicious. It's not the healthiest place and even though you can get a steamed piece of fish all of the sides are on the 'comfort' food side of things. There is a lot of deep fried. I'm pretty sure everything on the starters list is from the frier. But if that doesn't bother you then get involved. It's a little on the pricey side but being able to byo makes up for that. The mushy peas side was definitely my highlight and the tartare sauce is delicious. Lots of good wine bars and pubs to go to after in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. The 'bread and butter' literally white supermarket bread pre buttered.
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Extra hot sauce

d7YmKleq-LcFx_FEqU8dKQ.text: Great local fish and chip shop.Recently changed ownership, but the standards are being maintained. No more BYOB though!!! Which is a great shame

D5NDmSjg67OdXg_wR_9mKQ.text: Wow!  Amazing haddock, and equally amazing mushy peas!!!!! Only reason it's not 5 stars is that it's the only Fish and Chips place I've tried in London but it's definitely the best out of all I have tried in the states.No beer though--it's byob.Go now.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Haddock.......excellent!

b2lYCIdWKo3msWE1qbSKCQ.text: I saw this on a list of best BYOs in London so it was only a matter of time before i came to check it out. I had a bit of trouble finding it, as I walked into the Golden Eagle pub one street down by accident, and my friend had even more trouble because Marylebone Lane has a break in it and is not the easiest road to follow. But we got there in the end, with plenty of tourists did as well, so it must be featured in quite a few travel guides. One fellow diner even opened up his book and pointed to a picture of what he wanted to order!The restaurant lacked character for a place that seems to be a cultural institution, resembling a canteen with very little decoration on the wall and tables of 2 and 4. I think it would be difficult to come here with a large group because the restaurant can only seat 50-60 people. Their opening hours are only for a few hours each day so I wasn't able to call ahead and make a reservation, but I don't think they would be the type to take reservations in any case. We walked in and there were a few empty tables at the time so we were seated right away. As for the food, we ordered calamari to start and I got the fried cod and my friend got the fried haddock. There is an option to get it steamed, but I saw it on someone's plate and it didn't look all that great. There were about 7 options for fish and chips actually had to be ordered as a side, along with a few other items like peas or salad. We just got the chips as a side, and they were solid, good chips. The calamari was in sticks and tasty but nothing special. But I really enjoyed the cod, I would definitely recommend it!The service was great as well. There were at least 4 or 5 servers attending to diners and I never had a problem asking for water or more sauce. When we put our wine bottle on the table, someone came over with a corkscrew right away. And I was expecting there to be a 1 pound corkage fee, but that never showed up on our bill. Cheap night - in all, our meal was less than 25 pounds, which is less than most bottles of wine in a restaurant!

opv_txyJLqLLc9zZwKUiqA.text: Came here with my husband the other night after reading Yelp reviews. We both ordered the standard fish (cod) and chips. It could be because we're American, and possibly haven't had proper fish and chips before, but we both absolutely loved it.  The cod was excellent quality and had great texture (it tasted and looked fresh) and it was perfectly battered. The french fries (or chips) were also very good, they were a good amount of both crispy ( on the outside) and soft (on the inside). Along with loving the taste of the food, I also loved the restaurant as a whole. It was one of the cheapest places to eat at in this area, and you get a good amount of food for the price you're paying. I was also loving the atmosphere of the place. When we first walked in, we were greeted and seated by an older gentleman (possibly the owner or a manager). He was very pleasant and we made small talk when he took our order. My husband and I were watching everyone around us and lots of people seemed to know other people in the restaurant, so it seems like they get a ton of regulars.Anyway, we loved this place and if we were going to be in the area longer, we'd probably eat here again. I definitely recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish (cod) and chips. Very tasty.

9D0BfIAHXC7s6qITH68BiA.text: Note: management (and quality) has changed!! The lovely old Cypriot guy is no longer the owner.  Therefore quality & service standards have dropped dramatically! Cod was bland & tasted frozen. Chips were undercooked. Service was poor (the prior waiters have all left) with untrained Romanians. The new owners even removed that beautiful antique chip fryer! Very sad as this used to be the best fish in London...

43MylEU4nqTNAbvRUQxzuQ.text: Not the fake Elizabethan ship; a chippie.

RdWgtywybFyaXLIeV1g3VQ.text: I came here about a year ago (I know...10 years later) with my family and lets just talk about how my parents and I fell in love. This place was so amazing, not just the food but the workers as well. We had a gentleman talking to us and asking where we were from and just giving us such a warm welcome. The food is so amazing and the portions are huge. We were overall so impressed! My mom and I will be in London in two weeks and look forward to going back!

IKuvQcCua0I8r1DWjxUdUw.text: It's good fish - I had the cod. The fries/chips were underwhelming but not as bad as some others on here have made them out to be.Table service is expensive by international standards for what it is, but pretty much everything in London is expensive by international standards for what it is.I also didn't know what to tip because the credit card reader asked if I wanted to leave a tip. I thought British people didn't tip. Did this change?

8EagSZQhrl0cswAvQFqOQA.text: 109 reviews, averaging 4 stars.. the Golden Hind must be doing something right!  I've eaten here 3 times already (both dine-in and takeaway), and have never been disappointed in the fish. Luckily, when I dined in, I was able to snag a table right away, but I've never been caught waiting in a queue.  If you get there during prime time and its busy (as usual), expect to wait about an hour to get a table.  I tried the calamari and prawns + garlic - as Alex mentioned, very disappointing, I'm 99% sure they are pre-bought frozen stuff.. so avoid their appies altogether, don't bother wasting stomach space or money on this!  Onto to good stuff: the fish! There are a number of different fish offered, either fried or steamed.  I opted for the cod all 3 times.  The batter is light and crispy, not too greasy, and the oil didn't taste old.  Unfortunately, chips are an add on, and you can't eat fish and chips with the chips... can you?  Yeah, you can.. trust me!  The chips are nothing to rave about.  They've always been underseasoned (maybe its a London thing, where they don't salt the chips and leave it up to me.. if this is the case, then fine :) ), or incredibly mushy... a big disappointment there.  Size doesn't matter... does it?? In this case, not really!  When you order takeaway, you can choose to have a small or large piece.  If you're eating in, the fish you get is a very generous portion, so I'm assuming the large is the default when you eat in.  I usually have a monster appetite, but even I have my limits when it comes to fried food.  I could hardly finish off the small, so if you were to have a drink and possibly dessert / ice cream afterward, then you're set!  The difference comes down to pricing: its incredibly cheap to do takeaway here!  £4.50 for small, £6.50 for large.  £1.70 if you want chips.  Otherwise, if you eat in, I believe you will be paying around £9.50 for (large) fish, £2(ish) for chips, and a side of mushy peas.  Pretty steep!  I've been doing takeaway - but where to eat?  Don't be fooled by Manchester Square on Google Maps - its locked up and accessible by those who have keys to it.  This might not be the classiest move, but if you walk down Thayer Street (at Hind street), there are 2 park benches on the corner.  I usually plunk myself down there and chow down before the fish gets cold!  So all in all: grab the fish as a takeaway, and if you really need chips, just go to McD's and pick up fries afterwards.  Its much more satisfying! Don't miss out!*** Closed on Sundays ****** BYOB !!! ***

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. 4.50 fish, 1.70 chips (not recommended!).. Definitely a steal for some of the best fish in the city!  Closed on Sundays.

vFbusbC3FWKvHRcsGyyk-g.text: Come early. This place fills up fast. You can't really go wrong with the fish and chips (after all, it is kind of focused on just fish and chips).

9xNYYDUiMS1IAF1MJqPv7w.text: Awesome fish and chips with mushy peas!! Should really be 4.5 stars...minor deduction for less then attentive wait staff who became more preoccupied talking on their cell phone rather then checking if another round of pints was needed!

aX2_6_lRG2avhFLrQCC82g.text: The variety of fish is amazing, but the chips are even better. Best part is you can bring a bottle of wine in with you!

5adzy60N9r29s14iGgdrxA.text: Best fish and chips I have ever had, and I have been taste testing many places!!!! I recently went to the Golden Hind for Haddock, chips, and mushy peas (which are all ordered separately by the way) and was extremely impressed. The service was spot-on, and our ability to take our own beer made for a perfect evening. Maybe a bit pricier than other locations but so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Yummmmy haddock!

mN7hHyf9xrNlbctsBQxADw.text: Where better to have your Friday fish and chips than a Fish and Chip shop!  Noticed this restaurant when walking by and how busy it was.  This is generally a good sign.   Make sure you get here early lunch time for a Friday as it quickly gets busy as 12:30 strikes.Tables are tightly packed so probably don't select this place for a quiet intimate meal or, to have a private conversation!I thought the order took a while to arrive and hoped this was due to it being cooked from fresh.  I ordered the small cod and chips.  When you compare what you get in takeaway bags vs when you sit to eat, always looks a lot less.  Had to ask for lemon which I thought would be served automatically on the side.  Surely a perk of eating in?The meal was a nice portion of fish and chips.  Very filling having initially thought the chips were a little sparse.  The batter was nice and crispy and the chips freshly fried.  Having eaten all that and feeling particularly full with very little time to spare given the long wait for the main, I did take a look at the dessert menu.  This was a selection of ole skool puds.  Treacle sponge, bread and butter put, raspberry sponge, to name a few.  All served with either ice-cream or custard.  I selected the raspberry sponge and custard and was immediately thrown back to the school hall eating my pudding only without the lumps or skin on the custard.  Yummm.I would come back here if only to try the treacle sponge but, good fish and chips an added bonus!

zKfD9gmcn0jHPm8qwYLvXg.text: A friend recommended this place, so it was a must stop when we were visiting London.  The best fish and chips!  Fish is super fresh and just absolutely delicious.  Very good price, and staff was friendly.

tC9-ENzW8KvcSjyMCCOE-w.text: Simply smashing bangers and lox. Sauteed lightly with biters makes for a scrumptious snack. The place could use a good sweeping and some new paint, other than the details, this is a fabulous place to meet bloaks and sheilas.

HJxb2zZaYsRwEAhBc6uyqQ.text: A grand little fish shop with the tastiest of batters in the local vicinity off Oxford Street. Old wooden seats with the least of charm, but a heavy air of fish and chips continually passing past your nose. There are better places but when you're in need for a quick fix, this is your plaice (hehe).

wsatyMsqYCKXkV0P05NfDw.text: Went there the day we got off the plane.  The fish and chips were good.  But, like some of the reviewers were saying, they tasted kind of bland.  On the last day of our london trip, we went to North Sea.  OMG, we should have started our trip there instead.  The fish and chips there were the best....

XnpobB6PrlZLv_B6RJ0hfw.text: Just went to this place today, the fish was great come with right portion as well. Restaurant is a bit small but nothing wrong with small fish & chips anyways

WfKcYBWYyfg0saChkiexWw.text: Maybe I had high expectations as this was the highest rated London restaurant on Yelp.  Fish was was fresh but pretty bland tasting.  Chips were okay.  Overhyped IMO.

upR-oy70e1eFp4AmJvGLSA.text: Gorgeous art deco splendour at this Marylebone chippy nearing its 100th birthday. The food is almost as gorgeous as well. The only downside is that, for fish and chips (even quality fish and chips) the prices are rather steep. I suppose diners pay for the location as much as for the meal, which many seem happy to do. I'm certainly one of those happy to fork a little extra knowing the meal will be wonderful and served in such a unique setting. I mean really, the Golden Hind is an extraordinary little eatery (with a time forgotten quality) and everyone reading this review should definitely sit within the grandeur of its pre-World War One interior. And if you don't like fish (or chips) just get a cup of tea or a satisfying pud.

a6jELpPD36auYDXG35Gr6Q.text: I've been in this restaurant one time with my friends, but I'll go there again for sure! This is a 2 floor restaurant, not so big but comfortable and it's one of the most old and traditional places where people can eat the real fish and chips. The waiters are kind and helpful and the service is quick. The food is very very good! They offer different kinf of fresh fish and tasty fries with sause. Great place highley recommended!

iejP8-SwjGexkHQ2OlfGJQ.text: Really cant rate this place enough. Possibly the best fish and chips you'll find anywhere in London. Such great quality food, and if you dont want all that fatty batter, try the steamed fish.

QvKf_EF2WlrYyuszldOISg.text: really enjoy going there on a friday night...there's a Nicholas winery around the corner where you can go and buy your (good) white wine or rose for that matter , and for cheaper options you could go across the road to the tesco express for their crap selection. the fish is succulent, (nearly) always fresh , the batter cooked perfectly, and the oil of excellent quality! the chips are big and soft, with not enough cruncy ones which i love. th decor is lovely, down to earth and the clientelle varies from locals to tourists that have picked up on it through reviews and guides. service is quick...ahhh and their tartare sauce is home made (as it should be).top!!!

O6C7j4HUqcNYuEO1KGAocw.text: This is quite simply the best fish and chip shop in the whole of London! Although slightly pricey, the food is really delicious and better then I've tasted anywhere else. On the menu is the usual  cod, haddock and scampi etc. All of course served with great tasting chips, not in the least bit soggy. Tables are allocated on a first come first served basis and as the restaurant is fairly small it is often hard to get a table, particularly on a Friday or Saturday night. It is also possible to get a takeaway which is a solution. Highly recommended.

R08wS1VvB3tVop_yqWgavw.text: It was simply the best fish and chip shop ever. Highly recommended.Its quite a gem of a place,for all those on diet try the steamed option with salad-fantastic.

E8zJ88Ah4lpREN6fQ468TQ.text: Very informal. Best fried fish we've ever had, and the chips were pretty good too.

1hyBqFy6zkAurb_iFsANmw.text: Unfortunately I've stumbled on some very important information..... The Golden Hind is closed for business.

bIJzR3juZlcE2eQCRi_7Wg.text: True tis a bit pricey for fish and chips but not in that area of london. But for your money you get delicious fish, chips and mushy peas. Most importantly of all you can bring your own wine(or buy it in the offie across the road) and the very lovely gentlemen don't charge you corkage! That fact in itself makes the food really good value!!

wT_644PgZZ6qs3XS67atSQ.text: It was a good sized order of fish and chips.  Portions are honestly huge.  We could've shared an order of the plaice and chips had we known.  I found the batter nice and crispy, but the fish ended up being a big on the greasy side due to the size of the filet.  I'd go again, but I'd share an order.

fKi5Qdb7OY3EYAYhBOXbyA.text: Very simple but VERY delicious. Portion of chips was big enough for two as was the fish so only order if you are really hungry. The batter was crisp and not even remotely greasy. The tomato salad was the perfect accompaniment, but £3 for a gherkin was a joke. This place isn't fancy but always busy.

Hma_LTQa6RCwT15APqSc0g.text: A long established fish & chips restaurant frequented by tourists and regulars.  Service was efficient and friendly.  My order of skate wing and chips was freshly prepared, the fish tasted very fresh without excessive oily batter.  One new fact I learnt from the manager/owner was that skate wing bones are edible, so no risk of choking on fish bones!Golden Hind is conveniently located near Selfridges where you can have a quick meal at reasonable cost during a shopping trip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Skate wing & chips

wqIRwryYlKUxMhLVgwgJzA.text: The menu is simple, the ambiance is not great (old fashioned with a diner vibe) but the fish and chips are GREAT! I tried a few places on my trip to London, however this was the best place.  The service was very quick and the waiters were helpful in making a selection. If you are on a trip, it is also very nice to take a walk around the neighborhood after an outstanding meal! Also, it looked like most individuals at the restaurant were locals because the owner greeted everyone and asked how the family or the holidays were for them. Also, some patrons brought holiday gifts for the owner.

_pF-5Yx1XVr8AylYLvCkZw.text: I've been here twice. Once was absolutely spot on and the other was disappointing.The first visit I had the best fried cod I've ever had. Perfect batter, huge portion, piping hot, and very crispy. The second time I had haddock and it was extremely wet. So wet it soaked through the bottom of the batter and made a mush just sitting on the plate. It also didn't taste very fresh. Hopefully if I go again the cod will be better.You can order your chips to preference, which is great. When ordered crispy they are a bit dry, but for me that is infinitely preferable to soggy or soft.

EN4vJH7O5eTxBn1i7OQ0Ug.text: I was craving fish and chips and The Golden hind was on my list to try, so we did!It was good, but just nothing special so I'm struggling to write much about it!The restaurants is really casual and I did love the BYOB option. Ideal for a cheap catchup with some friends before you venture off somewhere else, but again you could do better. I had cod and chips, with some mushy peas on the side. All 3 were good, none were amazing. The chips were the best bit, and although chips need to be good at a fish and chip shop....I think the fish is the key, and that was not crispy enough for me.All in all, I'm glad I went, but I will be trying a good few other places before I return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Golden Hind-Cod, Chips Mushy peas

OzAI9dXQ45ElmUV9BzChnQ.text: Yelp led us here for the first time about a year ago, and we are fairly certain all the other tourists followed the same search/filter discovery process.We talked to the proprietor Mr. Cristou afterwards and he did say he sees a lot of Americans coming into the shop - we ugly Americans will be doing our part to support the Golden Hind.  It's the humble fish and chips and not life-changing cuisine but there is something about this place that sets it apart from the others we've been to - maybe it's that we're in the dish's homeland, maybe it's the oil.  There is all kinds of ways to screw this dish up and make it more greasy than it needs to be, but it was just right here.Not much else we can say as the setup and menu is pretty simple - you can choose different combinations of large/small cod/haddock with chips.  The portions here are actually pretty healthy and the large is probably enough for two people - contrary to others, we did not find the mushy peas to be all that interesting, and the headline fried items are certainly enough to keep us coming back every time we are back in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Large cod and chips

q5lfM4oennGFuJsYdCIZeA.text: Best fish and chips I've ever had! Not great ambiance (don't worry, that won't change the taste of your food), it's a dine-and-go kinda place with a constant flow of patrons. You can bring your own wine in and they will give you glasses! Tons of fish options for your main course and a surprising number of side options, including peas three different ways. Oh- and they have their own house tarter sauce, which is fabulous and light (unlike many other tarter "sauces"). Had the cod and fries (chips) with mashed peas. The fish was cooked to perfection and crispy, not a bit soggy. You won't find a freezer bag in their kitchen because the freshness is evident in their food. Flavors are outstanding all around. Service was fantastic. We tipped extra because we were so happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Huge portions! And delicious!
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Old place that has perfected fish and chips!

tipaB5BUP64f4pFYjJeDOg.text: It was a particularly good haddock. The reputation is deserved. Douse liberally with vinegar.The fries are a bit too mush though. The mushy peas, on the other hand, are a good amount of mushy. Being mushy peas.

PPvKuSbrfxi8YZ8CM1dCeQ.text: I'm really no expert on fish and chips, but my experience was generally positive. I arrived here on a rainy August afternoon with the restaurant being half-full. The atmosphere was very laid-back. The staff were very friendly and helpful in explaining things to us as well as the two Japanese girls at the table next to us.As for the food itself, it was decent. The cod was tender on the inside with a crunchy exterior. The chips were similar. It was certainly better than what I've had in Canada. We each ordered a small and it was very filling, and the bill came up to around 25 pounds with two Cokes, not bad when compared to the high prices usually associated with eating out in central London.So overall:Food: 4/5Service: 4/5Atmosphere: 3.5/5

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

pJzwRKnHfM5CHXv6K-Ja2A.text: Large Haddock fish for 9.10 GBP was tasty at the Golden Hind in quaint old Marlebone neighborhood. Chips were an extra 1or 2 pounds.  Exhausted with jet lag so we could hardly keep our tired heads from plopping down in our bowl of mushy peas!Fish was nice and fresh and flaky, and not too greasy. Staff was friendly and helpful. Casual atmosphere at this historic local spot. BYOB so we brought wine and they provided glasses. If you are in the area, give them a try. (-;  It's a casual spot close to the Marylebone hotel and not too far from regents park.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Haddock fish & chips. Yum. The Golden Hind.
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Large haddock fish & chips for 9.10 British pounds sterling. Side of mushy peas.
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish & chips at the golden hind

d8KWQ4J-WR2UU-VV8kuB1A.text: I have a weakness for Long John Silvers. I know, I know. Judge me all you want but don't eeeeeven try to deny that those crispies aren't delicious. This is relevant because the Golden Hind is like real food LJS. They manage to emulate that same crispity crunchety flavorful fish without being, you know, gross.  Ye Olde GH isn't at all what I expected. I imagine tucking into fish and chips at a scarred wooden table, worn brocade seats, tucked in a corner at some pub but this restaurant is bright, open and BYOB. We sat and ordered our haddock, mine a small, his a large. Both of us got chips. Neither of us got peas. I ran to Tesco (just down the street) to get us some beverages. Note: There is a pound charge if you bring your own but it's still much cheaper than actually buying drinks at a bar.  Two gigantic pieces of Haddock, a pile of chips and some cold beers later, we were stuffed and happy and ready for the next cocktail. Golden Hind is a fantastic fish and chips experience that you owe your fried food loving heart.

gU_hyfk-GH8VglmllQjmAw.text: The best fish and chips in London. Much better than those in New York. Love love love. Thank you those who posted their reviews. It was truly helpful for us being in London for the first time.

UDsFyMRzh-dXidGL_oLONQ.text: Excellent place for a plate of fish and chips while you're staying in London. I found this hidden gem tucked after reading Yelp! reviews and decided to check it out. I was very impressed with the crispy fish and chips along with great service.co tried the fried feta cheese, which was really salty, and I don't think I'd give that another go as well as the mushy peas, which were okay. Overall, I'll come back when I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fried Feta Cheese
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips

540JjrevyvRDWb2-q4J9tA.text: This place is the real deal. You can tell that it is full of locals as the owner personally greets many people walking through the door. Everything is fresh and delicious. BYOB so grab a few beers and pop in for some fresh fish and chips!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish cakes and salad!

WuyGsz-2P_0_SoUBw9UGLg.text: Heard this was a fish and chips haven so I made sure to check it out while I was in London.I had the cod with chips and mushy peas. It was a huge portion! The cod was flaky on the inside and crispy on the outside but a little too oily for my liking. The chips were thick and cooked well. The mushy peas were just mushy peas. Everything could have used a bit more salt. Nice and attentive staff. No WiFi.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Cod with chips and mushy peas

pGxImjznhtwwYhmEypX1QA.text: I've heard so many good things about this place that perhaps my expectations were too high. In fact for what I got, they were way too high.Set in the trendy area of Marylebone Lane, The Golden Hind is a kickback to where most cafes and fish and chip shiops in London cosisted of hard chairs and formica topped dining tables.The basic environment actually lent well to the food it serves. I felt sure that my fish and chips would be exceptional - They were not! I ordered a portion of chips with battered Plaice. Th plaice tasted good, but the batter was to thick for me. There just seemed too much batter in relation to the white of the fish itself. The chips were also too dry for my liking, and warm rather than hot. I used a lot more tartar sauce than I would normally, to detract from the dryness of the meal. The cup of tea I had looked like a proper builders strong tea, but rather than coming up in a good builders size cup, it was served in quite a small cup with saucer.At £15 including service, to me it was not good value. In act when we left, we passed the new Ivy Cafe, also on Marylebone Lane. They offer a fish and chip meal including mashed peas for £14.50. I think I might be trying their fish and chips next time.

yms7Ktygvcv83Q4kKWLcRg.text: My wife and I chose this restaurant after seeing it on one of those video blogs, touting it as a "must eat" restaurant for fish and chips. So off we went after a full day exploring London and a side trip to Abbey Road to have a picture taken crossing the iconic crosswalk from Beatles' Abbey Road album cover. The place was a bit of a challenge to locate as TA wasn't that accurate, but we managed to find the place.My wife and I had high expectations for this place.
