It was busy when we got there but we were seated promptly and shown the menu. After briefly consulting the server, we both opted for cod and shared an order of chips with some water. The fish served were in large portions...it had a nice crunchy outside and fresh and flaky inside...if not a bit on the oily side. We were expecting to be "wowed" but came away unimpressed. We both thought the fish lacked flavor...maybe because we've grown accustomed to American beer battered fish that is full of flavor...and this fell short of our expectations. Additionally, we felt service at this place seemed detached.We both felt the food was OK...but definitely not something to go out of your way for.

WM7KiAz_heuNHgKSc47qyw.text: Smallish place, but I got there late for lunch, maybe 2:15 so pretty empty.  Cod was great and was a big portion, and I only ordered the small size.  Chips were ok, but not great. Mostly they were very thin that you could snap in half, not the chunky British chips that are so good. Authentic old school, but I've had better overall. I'd go back but wouldn't go out of my way like I did today as I'd heard it was one of the best in London.

KT44MQi46Spx8ysKv5LFzA.text: Little mom and pop joint with excellent fish and chips. About 5-6 varieties of fish and sides.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Cod and chips

GMbD_cYquiMPON4_BneyWQ.text: Been getting my Fish & Chips here for ten years and no matter where else I try I always end up coming back here - Fish & Chips doesn't get any better in London. It's as good when you take away as it is in the restaurant, where you can bring your own bottle of wine and there is always a good atmosphere.Highly recommended!

H7V7WbobspRQhcgBjgkJNQ.text: Well, let me confess at the beginning itself that being a Bengali it was very unlikely that i would be disappointed by a restaurant specializing in fish ... especially since i was having some after so long.Having said that, i should also say that i really liked the food. So much so that i went back twice in 3 days. I have had the haddock with mushy peas and chips (yum) and the cod fish cakes. Both were good. The fish was of  good quality, and not as oily as in most other fish and chips places i have been to in England. The place is usually very crowded (its really small) and so you can expect a 15 min wait at any point, though you can book for large groups. The staff is friendly and makes every effort to get you in quickly. Once i went alone and there was a guy behind me alone. So they asked whether we would be ok sitting at the same table. He refused.The golden hind also taught me a new virtue of not smoking. We were there in a group and the desserts arrived when half of us were out smoking. They had very little left for themselves by the time they returned :)P.S: It doesn't sell alcohol but allows you to bring your own.

ElSJW0haXhzGpX87HMCKUA.text: Unless you want to eat your chips while holding your nose, don't bother!This place stinks like spoiled frying oil and every surface is sticky gross.  Sorry, guys, but taste is more than just what goes in your mouth, it's influenced by sight, smell, touch, too.  Lots of other fish and chip options that are as authentic and much more appealing.

xwczMD3k75jTJdQGElOVTQ.text: I went back for a re-visit and was very disappointed. The chips were dry, fish did not taste very fresh, and the portions have got smaller- making it very pricey for around £13 for cod and chips. The Rock and Sole place in Covent Garden is much better.

zkPSC4IlIbwzj1eUMl3rag.text: Wonderful is one of the many words that can be used to describe Golden Hind! The cod, chips and mushy peas were the perfect combination of flavours. This fish and chips shop is nestled on the chic Marylebone Lane, yet is unassuming and low key! There is limited seating, so arrive early on the weekends to avoid a long wait.

uUHY5lZAmdNh8ICANpZU3w.text: Another fish and chippy favourite of mine and I do recommend you give it a go!  The Golden Hind for me is only meant for lunch as the decor is not much but when it comes to serving great fish and chips, you could certainly do a lot worse.

8YIm4GyoKvgmdbNvEtAitA.text: Won't repeat on the other reviews but will add make sure you leave room for desert.    Had the best jam sponge and custard, ever. Partner had equally good apple crumble with ice cream. Recommend you go and think about reserving a table if going after 1930hrs, even midweek.

W1RVLOw99yJh22wuA4ddNg.text: excellent traditional fish and chips. the lovely thing is you get to choose your type of fish, and you really can't go wrong with the selection. i happened to choose cod, while my dining partner chose haddock. both were sensationally flaky, crispy, tender, juicy, and tasty! the fish was well enough on its own, but they also give you a large cup of homemade tartar sauce, which was probably the best i've ever had. not too overbearing and full of pickles, but just the right combination of smooth and tart. i chased this with the regular order of chips while my partner chose mushy peas and chips. i personally thought the peas were a little bland, but he seemed to delight in it. he still coos about the mushy peas to this day. food = yes. service = people were a little short, but it's to be expected in a place with such a long line and high table turnover. price = good to moderate, depending on what you get. the portions are large and filling!

oCyCU75o_tJj9aBUoqmfCg.text: The fish was phenomenal! I didn't care too much for the chips, could be because I'm American, but by god, the fish was worth 5 stars alone! I've never had better in my life. And I suppose being 19-years-young doesn't add much credibility to that statement, but all I can say is that if I were a permanent resident in London, I wouldn't even bother trying any place else for fish and chips. Cheers to good eats and byob!

Mqo1uNNewvYhYl4Gk-jcLA.text: Three American gals came here on a rainy evening hoping to fill our bellies with authentic British fare. Based on the raving reviews, I was really expecting to be blown away, and everyone around us chomped down on their fish and mushy peas with a look of pure ecstasy on their face. Perhaps I'm just not a huge fan of fish and chips, but I found the food to be bland, though well-portioned, and no amount of ketchup, tartar sauce or lemon juice could make my taste buds sing with joy. The mushy peas were certainly more appealing than they looked, although I thought they just tasted like beans. However, I do like the BYOB concept and it's one of the better fish and chips I've had in London. I never thought I would utter this sentence, but the spotted dick was tasty! We left stuffed, yet a bit unsatisfied...I just like my fish more flavorful. But if you do love fish and chips, this is worth a try.

NxI0znwYl1MKQHZ2zQONDg.text: Okay, I'm from the U.S., so take this with a grain of salt, but I absolutely love this place.  It's a sweet, no frills spot and the food was excellent.  The fish and chips were perfection - light, sweet and delicate.  And I now find myself having dreams about mushy peas.  Let's not forget the treacle sponge too.  I have no idea if their treacle sponge meets anyone's standard of excellence, but I was happy.  Can't wait to get back for a return visit.

UMc59lhulg966rxEPEIdLQ.text: best fish and chips of my life. crispiest, brown, dark outside (was honestly like shake n bake on fish) light lovely and not heavy fish (had the haddock) aiight fries with that crazy sweet british ketchup and artery clogging treacle pudding. service is direct and no frills. byob. pretty fun and exactly what i wanted. just good food and a place to have some drinks and chill sans attitude.

EBu9rspC3A_Y5twLIPWgLw.text: Forget soggy chips and fish in a crispy-too-hard batter from you local chippie. You haven't had real fish and chips until you've eaten at Golden Hind- the variety of fish is impressive and it makes from changing from only cod and chips i other restuarants. The scampi with excellent is excellent and I have to agree with other reviewer that calamari is also excellent. It's a great idea that you can bring your own alcohol which makes dining at Gold Hind very good value for money. The staff are very friendly and there is a very realxed atmosphere at Golden HInd which I love. Definately one of the best, if not the best, London fish and chip restaurants.

9qQylwJr2t7k_VHrYcu9Qw.text: First taste of Fish & Chips and I had it at The Golden Hind.  Glad we (plus boyfriend) got a recommendation from friends of friends.  We tried the haddock and the cod, both were really fresh and fried to perfection (golden brown and the batter didn't fall off the meat).  The condiments: tarter sauce, malt vinegar, ketchup - surprised - and salt/pepper are set up ready on each table for your own mixing and use.  If you're like our table of four, you'll ask for more tarter sauce...goes great with the fish!  I, however, only need a tad bit of salt and a liberal douse of vinegar.  Yum.  Definitely save room for the dessert, not quite sure what the Spotted Dick (w/ custard) is...and was too immature to order it, so I opted for the next best thing - and what a smart choice - the Bread & Butter Pudding (w/ custard). The dish was warm - unexpected - and divine!  Gimme more!!!  Oh, and the mushy peas...it was just that, mushed up peas, I added a bit of salt to taste; overall I tried it and might just save my stomach for more of the starchy chips in my stomach.  Yum.

Kh-N04ObDhtyOTjj8WYFWw.text: We ate here on what turned out to be a successfully foodie weekend. Didn't know anything about it and stumbled upon it closed, then thought it looked so old fashioned and traditional that we'd come back in the evening. That was a good move even though we were nearly scared off by the crowds and confusion outside. The chips and peas weren't fantastic, but the battered haddock was wonderful, light and fantastic quality. I lived in Yorkshire where we only ate haddock fried in beef dripping and don't normally like southern fish and chips, but this was great. I loved the old friers in the restaurant and the slightly down at heel feel, made it more authentic in my opinion. The prices were great for London - really good value.

MQbJv6mvgn_BVm5yoYhNNg.text: My dinner at the Golden Hind was very good--I ordered the mushy peas, cod, and chips. If you happen to be in this part of London, I definitely recommend a visit. As a tourist, it was important to me to 'check the box' on eating at an authentic fish and chip restaurant since they are a dying breed. However, if you are from the US and have good fried fish near you (e.g. you're from the Gulf Coast) you might skip it and go for something you can't get at home.

CrMDd_yG9EySQ_yghz4DVg.text: So delicious.  I went trolling all over London so many times with different people...family, friends, and I was literally one of those crazies who ate fish and chips everywhere in an attempt to find the perfect joint that I will love forever and return to for years to come.  I always recommend it to friends who are visiting London.Finally found the Golden Hind by suggestion of a friend during my last trip over and it was gloooorious.  It's a small place run by some campy Greek guys and gets pretty packed during peak hours so we were lucky to snag a table.   The batter was tasty, the fish was firm and fresh (I remember the proprietor explaining where he had gotten the fish..unfortunately I was far too into my food to pay attention and he only had the attention of 1/4 of our table), and their tartar sauce is on point.  Can't stand places with bad tartar sauce.One thing you must try here: the MASHED PEAS.  It didn't sound particularly appealing, but there's something about the taste and texture that goes peeerfectly with great fish and chips.

yNv2HdLUjOnuj_0pBx-hGQ.text: Very well known f&c for its fresh supply of different fishes, low prices and authentic atmosphere. Now it's also packed on weekend evenings and kind of greasy + if you want great take-away fish for roughly the same price you may also go to the fishmonger further up Marylebone High Street. A nice place, but its real perk is that you can bring your own bottle, with no cork charge !

2w2HcrMFffM0-1gsxw_-Yg.text: apart from The Fish Shop in Angel, the GH offers the best fish and chips in town. super service, charming and local. They let you bring your own bottle of wine.

vkomRFz_BLq3cJqbDuTahg.text: Great fish & chips! Best I had in London. I had the small cod (SO great that they have "small" & "large" fish options) & chips, with mushy peas. Everything tasted wonderfully. Fish was soft & cooked just right. Mushy peas were tasty & had great, slightly lumpy consistency. YUM!The service was nice & informative about their food. The restaurant & seating area itself is small, like a little cafe or bakery.I definitely recommend this place.

dVAuw-kUSlIUFTn4uyP1kQ.text: The best spot for fish and chips! It was my first time and a great place to try a UK specialty. The wait was not too long, the fish delicious and crispy without being greasy, and the tartar sauce was best of all. Very casual, but a good place to try this dish if you don't want to be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. The Classic plate!

fBz5OIaj-vQ3OZ9Uldb9-w.text: We chose the Golden Hind based on the numerous positive review. Maybe our expectation was too high. We were completely underwhelmed by their fish and chips.We ordered the cod and the haddock just to compare (although our waitress told us they taste the same). They were flaky, but neither the cod nor the haddock had much flavor. The batter on the haddock was crispy but the batter on the cod was a bit soggy.Since trying fish and chips in London was on the top of my list, I have to say our experience here was disappointing.******************************If you found something useful in my review, please hit "useful" so that I can improve my reviews. If you love food and traveling, follow me, or better yet, let's become friends on Yelp! Thank you and happy Yelping!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Haddock (small) with chips (3 stars)

ZN0gqmoXYb4mDVX4RKe4oA.text: First time in London, so fish and chips was a MUST for us. After doing some quick research The Golden Hind stood out. So we went for it. The food was totally AMAZING. Perfect fish. Pleasant fish taste, and very fresh fish. But what really stood out was the batter. The batter was not soggy and not greasy. Perfectly seasoned. Service was very good. The staff was helpful and gave us good recommendations. Price was acceptable. Well worth a visit for first timers and fish & chip veterans.

vfVZxfoMg3nGBX_1WmvbQA.text: Fish & Chips are a staple for anyone in London seeking a good meal. Though their prices can be exorbitant given its touristy association, The Golden Hind manages to keep prices reasonable and deliver on its promise of delicious fried fish.We came here after dropping by another establishment for breakfast but left unsatisfied. While we were only the second party after it opened, the restaurant quickly filled with locals and tourists alike. Sounds like this spot may have been featured in a guidebook or two!We started off with their Fried Calamari which ended up being six rings with not much else to rave about. It was simple and good but would pass on the next time. However, moving onto the actual fish and chips, we each got our own critter and decided to split the chips. THIS WAS THE BEST DECISION EVER.Our fish came out shortly after the appetizer and it was massive. For less than £10, you've got yourself a giant plate of food. One order of chips was enough for the two of us so please be aware if you decide to order individually. If you can't decide what fish to order, definitely go for the cod. Despite it looking a bit smaller, it's superior in taste and juiciness than the haddock option. They were both crispy and satisfying.The Golden Hind was  a great experience. It did end up getting busy so service started lacking and we ended up paying at the front. However, for the price and quality, you can't go wrong with enjoying fish and chips here at their establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

X7l1e_gFskQuJsDU2wBhwQ.text: Even though we had a long day, we still had to eat.  Fish and Chips was on our list of things to eat while in London, and I found the Golden Hind that was about a 10 minute walk from our hotel. The place was in the middle of many popular eateries. Despite the cold evening, people didn't mind queuing up for these restaurants.  Lucky there was a short line for the Golden Hind, and our wait was about 15 minutes.The specialty of the restaurant was fish and chips, and they were known for their generous serving. The Yelp reviews were spot on.  Stephen and I could have shared a plate, and got a side of chips and mushy peas.  The price was fair, and the food was good. I would come back again, and recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Sides menu
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Outside

Ocf6IFHrYpa_ufNpNx715w.text: In London for vacation and decided to try out the fish and chips at this establishment. I've had fish and chips all over california and wanted to see what it would be like to have it here in London.... and yeah, it's pretty awesome:Ordered:-Fish and Chip (Cod) - the breading is light and flakey; fish was incredibly fresh and a large portion.  Well branded vinegar and good tartar sauce was included. Score: 9/10-Water - water is sold in a bottle.  Why cant I be offered tap? Score: 5/10-Service: fast and friendly. Score: 9/10I loved this place.  If I were to come back, I will definitely swing by.

blEWU1vKT8CEkALUBKwCGg.text: That fish thoughhhh. So light, airy, and crispy. Never had mushy peas before and they'd taste how you expect; not bad but meh. I'd absolutely come again

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

jKiAwyuAuqNuvXmm7mVCRQ.text: I just wanted to try some fish and chips in U.K. and this place was really close to my hotel. It was pretty busy on a sat night but the service was still pretty good. I ordered small order of fish and chip to take away. Overall I didn't like it much. For some reason, the fish was a little fishy. Maybe it's way they cooked fish here? But anyway I had my fish and chips in UK.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

Q0LMjXH8Jc6ICy5nkjNXzw.text: One of my favorite places to stop when I am craving some fish and chips.  Casual atmosphere can get busy at lunch but wait is not to long.  The fish is fried perfectly no matter which type you get the mushy peas are tasty.  If you want fish and chips this is your place

Sv-sPdor9FmQ0cf0-kt_cQ.text: Great Fish & Chips! I got the cod my buddy got the haddock both were very similar tasting. The fish and the chips were fried perfectly! We had the Greek mixed pickles which paired very well with the fried food. Worth trying out for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. This is it!
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish & chips and mushy peas
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Greek mixed pickles went well with the fish & chips!

NMdg05OOFv1m9Eumyoa2kQ.text: We made a special trip to the Golden Hind after reading the online reviews and accolades. We are so glad we did!We truly enjoyed our large portions of fresh flaky cod, fried in a crispy beer batter that arrived piping hot and GREASELESS to the table.  That trick is all about the temperatire of the oil throughout the cooking process, and they have that deicate dance down pat at the Golden Hind.The generous portion of thick-cut chips were fluffy inside, and again perfectly fried and greaseless.  As we have learned in the UK, they needed a bit of salt.  We understand why most British chips aren't salted:  Brits love their "brown sauce" with chips, and if the chips are salted first, the brown sauce is way too salty.  So the lack of salt is not a ding, it's a DIFFERENCE.I appreciated the musky peas, which were a bright green borne of fresh English peas -- no canned mucky peas for the GH! 5 stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips -- note the chips are made of fresh potatoes :)
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Calamari and chips
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fried haddock and mushy peas

XK4BMUyWCTslLa8Iu9szeg.text: Can't visit Lindon without finding the best fish n chips ever.   Fried but not greasy (how do they do that!).  Was enough for two but I was alone so I couldn't just leave it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

3-RMcJC_mjwbOilfCL6FDg.text: Great place for some delicious fish and chips. Definitely try the Haddock fish it has a more bite to it and more flavorful. Mushed peas were ok buts chips were good. Typical American greasy bar food but very tasty. You have to wash it down with a beer. Service is good and the price's are very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Haddock Fish
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Great U.K. Larger

vRz3GFKec0dyfwLHOB1nGg.text: If this is the best fish and chips that you have eaten, you need to get out more.Food was decent, but batter was bland. Ordered the feta cheese sticks and they were DISGUSTING. I love cheese MORE than the next person, but WTF is this? Bizarre.Chips were good though, service was great, and there was no corking fee for bringing our own beer.

InA8iO31BVKBpklNIOHXtw.text: One of the best fish and chips I've had. Very fresh and large portions. I've probably could of shared one plate with my wife! Place was very vibrant and service was prompt. I made a special trip while visiting from the Bay Area, CA. One suggestion is that they could have kept the ketchup bottles full. Ours was empty, so when we took the ones off the other tables those were empty as well! All in all this place is legit!

ISeptfs91Y00V2wqZHNehg.text: We enjoyed the cod and chips with mushy peas. The fish tasted fresh, the batter was divine with a pleasant & satisfying crunch. Chips were also tasty as well as the mushy peas. Although I prefer a chunkier tartar sauce with more dill, the Golden Hind's smooth and creamy tartar complimented the cod very well. Staff at the register were kind and polite but wait stuff were lackluster and not personable. I would go back for the cod, no doubt!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Cod, chips & mushy peas. Also pictured: smooth and rich tartar sauce.

Tug3Rd6by-cZkbiE63xh6Q.text: Definitely some of the best Fish & Chips in London! A smiling staff adds to the experience, and the "Mushy Peas" are some of the best I have ever had. They don't do alcohol, but you can stop by the nearest off license and grab beer or a bottle of wine, which they will happily decant for you. The place is by no means posh, but it's a great vibe for a typical London Fish & Chippery!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Haddock & Chips- the BEST!

r2ajS4lu7KVkmfN7HhVDcA.text: The cod and the mushy peas is a must get at this fish and chips place! The staff recommended the feta sticks which we tried and I did not like it. It was too heavy in taste, would be yummy with a salad instead. The fish was not too oily which I liked. The portion was huge, we each got one and could not finish. I packed it to go and had it for lunch the next day - it was still crispy and delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Feta sticks
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with mushy peas

JgKkqVmv9XMH5CDm7Iu1bQ.text: Heard that this was the place to go if you're going to eat fish and chips - and you haven't really been in London without eating fish and chips, right?Maybe I'm not that big of a fan of fish and chips, but I was a bit disappointed. Service was good and I got a large portion of fish (cod) with mushy peas. The peas didn't have much taste and the chips was really not that great - even my boyfriend didn't finished his. On the plusside the owner was so so friendly and chatty.

dkd1QibJFAnMo290aZFqAw.text: After a long day of tourist activities last summer, I wanted to cap the evening with some good ole fish and chips and boy did they not disappoint. The portions are very generous. The fish was cooked to perfection with the perfect amount of crunch. And the chips very good like thick sliced potatos. On my next trip to London, I know exactly where to get my fish and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Fish and Chips w/ Ginger Beer

0B6fROXEAYsvWkQhvmgCEw.text: This was recommend by Fodor's 2010 England Travel book as a classic Fish & Chips.  Ordered the fried haddock (and of course, with a side salad...but then I saw all the Brit's were ordering mashed peas!) As a Bostonian that truely appreciates fresh seafood, this was absolutely delicious. When I go back to America, I will never look (or taste) fish and chips the same ever again :(Now, all I want is fish and chips for the remainder of my 12+ day trip here in London...haha BTW, love the BYOB policy!

vtaLavy_iDkRvDLGsuCjrA.text: For the price, could you really ask for more?  The combo we've found works nicely for us is the haddock with the Greek salad instead of fries. Yum!!  Its tasty, its quick, the salad is fresh. What's not to like?  Oh yeah, and its BYOB so you can get a beer across the road at the Tesco.

6UJwzUATBy3rwmiY41Bwsw.text: Best fish and chips that I've had! No fuzz, no smiles, just great food. Go for the basic: hand battered perfectly deep fried cod and chips. Don't forget to add salt and vinegar!

qSt7ozjkAZvKuILMD17H5g.text: My wife and I tried this place when we read about it in a travel book.  We ate once in the restaurant and once getting takeaway. The Golden Hind was a several blocks away from a flat we were staying in.  But it was worth the walk, even in the rain, to have the great fish and chips they serve. Oh, and the mushy peas are to die for - and I never liked peas that much! If I recall correctly, they don't serve alcohol, but you could bring your own if you wished.I dream of this place.

ks2gR0Fri8HvMnWUdrGQ4Q.text: Real authentic fish 'n chips place, regular stop on our visits to London.Great for the kids as well.

gAJHDAaVIzJRDMJM-qNhzA.text: Visiting the UK for the first time, I wanted to eat some authentic fish and chips in England.  Boy, was I glad I found the Golden Hind.  BYOB (and everyone does), cheap, fresh, and large portions of your favorite fried fish (I liked the rock salmon aka dogfish), plus don't forget the mushy peas!  I have to say, the mushy peas were the highlight of my meal(s) here.  It still baffles me how they make peas taste so good, and look bright green =D.And for your next stop, check out the Golden Eagle right around the corner!

Or57vkk7qNpmsyCw5EaOtw.text: If the human race were to send a plate of fish & chips w/ mushy peas out into space in order that some alien civilization might discover it, we would hire the Golden Hind for the job.

Nmb8HgzLDi9isulaN3nn9g.text: God I love this place. It is perfect. It is a beautiful venue with a pastel coloured art deco fryer at the back of the room, you can bring your own alcohol (there is a Tesco, Nicolas and a Waitrose on Marylebone high street) and the food is exceptional.It is a very small, intimate family run business- with a wooden plaque on the wall tracing back all the previous owners since its opening in 1914. The present owner is an excellent host- my friends and I go regularly and he always gives us a friendly greeting and sometimes comes and sits with us.Obviously the fish and chips are delicious, but I also recommend the fried calamari  and the cod goujons.

UYCNJBkN4rck6tbj0T3m0A.text: Mushy peas people, MUSHY PEAS!!! Bob and I were originally going to go to Seashells for our fish and chips fix while in London, but we were quickly talked out of it by our cabbie. He said that The Golden Hind was the place to get the British staple so we, of course, obliged. The place is darling. A little tiny restaurant with white paint and dark brown two-top tables. It feels very nautical when you walk in, which is appropriate. They had the place decked out in mismatched Christmas lights, which was perfect. The menu is small, don't expect to see some kind of Bennigan's sized menu when you sit down. We decided to have the (duh) fish and chips - Bob had the skate and I had the cod and we ordered a side of mushy peas as well. The fish is fantastic. I am not a fan of deep fried food - but this batter was light, very crispy and wonderfully flavorful. Unlike in the US - you can still taste the fish through the batter. The mushy peas were probably one of the best things I have ever had. They had the consistency of mashed potatoes? But they tasted very buttery and pea-ish. The chips (aka: fries) were the only thing that I was not a big fan of. I am not particularly fond of steak fries, I prefer mine smaller and crispier so, I was biased from the start. The overall experience was wonderful though - service and food were top notch. Grab that malt vinegar and pour it on, because this fish and chip stop is the one to enjoy in London!

6uwis71Qu7ExnpAnrx4p7A.text: very  basic place for fish and chips --  they were sort of greasy -- also, the peas were just ok --   i had the haddock -- no beer/alcohol- the  bored waitress stalked the tables - was always glaring at me -- i know i am gorgeous, but i generally dont like being watched every second i am eating  --

vSO9nQSjDkUidiINMNVkug.text: This is the local favorite fish and chip place. I found it on yelp and went there last time I was in London. it was true this is very local and popular place.. they don't open super late. so get there before 9pm and be prepare to wait..The place gives a family joint. warm/friendly vibe.. definitely not touristy.. we were probably the only foreigners in that place.. everyone seems know everyone..I got a local taste of London.. which was great...I would highly recommend if you are ever in London.. looking for something local.. try this place!!

RHw99uNb8KWfJImxhaPnEw.text: We once rented an apartment just a couple of streets from this neighborhood institution - it apparently has been here since the early days of World War I - and stumbled across it quite by accident. It was crowded and noisy and hot but everything we ordered was so delicious we ended up either eating here or getting takeaway a half dozen times during our two-week visit. We love the fish cakes studded with black pepper and the lightly breaded plaice, haddock, and calamari, and neither the fish nor chips are greasy. Be sure to try the mushy peas! There's no bar but you can bring in beer or wine from one of the nearby shops. Golden Hind definitely is worth a trip from anywhere in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

p7ZeoDt57LtLOXBhz6hywA.text: We were visiting London for the first time last week, and wanted to try authentic fish and chips. I read a review in my London Frommer's Travel Guide about The Golden Hind so we thought we would give it a try, and we weren't disappointed. The menu boasts a variety of different fish that one can choose...cod, hake, plaice, haddock. I chose the plaice as my fish,while my husband and daughter chose cod. Our fish was flaky and not greasy, with a good helping of chips and of course, mushy peas, that I have to confess, I didn't try...(I hate peas). My daughter and hubby liked the peas, but said they had a strange consistency, however, I actually thought they looked like mashed potatoes with a dash of neon green food coloring added for effect! Our meal was served quickly considering the amount of people in the tiny restaurant. The wait wasn't that bad either, but it is tight, with very little room to stand while you wait for a table. The place is a little run down, with wooden tables and chairs, old fixtures, and a retro serving buffet near the kitchen, but all in all, the food was good and the staff was friendly, especially the owner! Nice guy! It is BYOB, and that makes people sit just a little too long in a place where people are waiting outside just to get a table!

wn6jlydUViPwaBwOk7wLtw.text: Pics: Chopstix2Steakniveschopstix2steaknives.blog… I love my fish and chips. Coming to London, i was excited and was expecting awesome fish n chips to be found everywhere, Be it newspaper wrapped or served on a fancy plate. Sadly, it seems that what London has to offer is quite elusive. I was told that to find a good one, it will have to be outside of London.That is until I heard of The Golden Hind which came recommended. That got me quite excited and I happily roped in some friends for dinner there.Watching food passing you with its aroma enticing was too much while we waited for a late party to arrive. We decided to order some starters to tide our tummies over.Feta cheese fritters £3.4Whole tail scampi £3.6Interesting fried little bites. I like the crispy batter and both were tasty without being greasy.Fish and chipsWith some of us trying to be healthy, there were mixed orders of grilled fish and fried fish in the fish and chips order.The fish and chips are decent and of a good standard. They don't beat this in Whitby but as far as London goes, this will be one of the places that comes to mind when craving fish and chips.

V3o8mpCMozUrmoLcxd6Slg.text: Golden Hind isn't very good.At all.You will have to trust me on this, Americans.Yes, I know you've gone here and it may be the first fish and chips you've ever had, but it isn't the best.Think back to your virginity. Yes, there you go.I don't even know where to start. It's like, I don't know, like, kinda, NOT GOOD.It isn't.Really.Service was okay, I guess. Dude was friendly enough and took our order and at some point following that arrived with said order. This order wasn't good though, it was meh. Yes, meh. In fact, no it wasn't. It just wasn't good.Is any of this getting through?I don't want any of you wonderful Americans that haven't yet given it 5 stars to come here and not only feel obligated to follow suit, but to also leave our green and pleasant land feeling empty inside at your depressing fish and chips experience.It gets so much better. Ask my wife.I don't want to give it one star, but in a way it deserves it. Universal balance needs to be redressed somehow. Maybe I will go sacrifice a battered sausage instead.And by sacrifice I mean eat. But somewhere else.So, onto the review. The Fish wasn't presented well (batter was tasteless and too crispy) and the chips weren't that great.The end.

PUDHraKnwJl0W0Xi2FD0GQ.text: I'm from Texas so I might not know as much about fish and chips as an Englishman but I really wanted to try this countries signature plate while there! I tried it at two separate places within the same neighborhood, The Golden Hind and another place that I can't remember for the life of me. Both had great reviews as well so I gave both a try. The Golden Hind was better by 100x! The portions were much larger, the fish was much more tasty, and even the price was really competitive. I really appreciated the atmosphere and the attention from the waiter, he made sure that our visit was as pleasurable as possible. I highly recommend this place to anyone, foreigners or locals.

0YYveoFqqLj4b8eJy1GvcA.text: The place not a great on the Decor, but the "Fish n Chips" are off de hook. Good ole family service. Three of us visit the place and all three came out happy.Good Fish and chip spot.

cgf70TpbBB2IHGiffgDl0Q.text: The best fish and chips in London. Small unassuming place that is always crowded. Get there early and be prepared to wait but oh so worth it if you like traditional fish and chips. Family run (by a Greek family) and the service is excellent.

aiipaY1RnHU0Edo-ErtrHw.text: I went here to get my dose of fish and chips. I got a smaller portion of fish, and was dissapointed when the inside of my fish was not really as cooked as i'd have like it to be. Also, the chips here are really not that exciting, they are dry and tasteless and one wishes they could transport themselves to macdonalds to have some fries there.My friend got a larger portion of fish that is more expensive and not only was his cooked really well , it tasted totally different so i'm not sure what the story is there.This place has great service, but honestly my fish was undercooked. We also did have spotted dick. This is something you can pass on easily. Its whatever.

GaNqfd7lplFSgnZ0f9UGFA.text: The best fish and chips I have had in London and the other things on the menu were just as appetizing! It was crowded and I was a little bothered by the bring your own drinks only because it's annoying to run to the store to buy a beer, but nonetheless the people were nice and my stomach was overly satisfied!

YG1KXkoTbQS6ekmR1iRrSQ.text: Really great pick for my first Yelp review, and our first restaurant stop in London! No muss, no fuss, bring your own wine/beer fish and chips place. Adorable Greek man that runs the house, with multiple fishes and preps to choose from, as well as simple, delicious sides. Try the mushy peas, for a visitor to London as we were, it was essential and delicious, as well as the Greek pickles - homemade and great as well. The fried fish was a huge filet and perfectly prepared. The chips were normal, not anything amazing, but good nonetheless. We were happy to have this within a short walk from our hotel - definitely would recommend if in the area!

cmoJ-nP5YOnSVh_s0YicOA.text: The best fish and chips I've had in London. Their fish is absolutely humongous, and the mushy peas that came as a side were delicious.If you ever come to London, and want an authentic meal that actually tastes good, come here.

D4SldEjOJJCzHmRPmHKoIw.text: The best fish and chips in London. If you are also looking for something a little more healthy you have have their steamed cod. The staff are always helpful but be ready for a little wait outside as it can get very busy. But worth the wait and very reasonably priced.

hLpHfwkA1s7d3-sNYtsSlg.text: I emerged from the Bond Street tube station and promptly walked in the wrong direction. A quick glance at a map and I was able to correct my course and head down Marylebone Lane.I passed 70 Marylebone Lane and became puzzled at the absence of the chip shop I was hunting. But then I remembered that in London, street numbers do not necessarily correspond on both sides of the street (so 73 Marylebone Lane might be several blocks away from 70 Marylebone Lane on the opposite side of the street.)Haddock is definitely the way to do if you like big, flaky white fish. I enjoyed the cod and another type of fish as well but the haddock stole the show.Know this:-Mushy peas are a must.- The desserts are nothing to look at but delightful (warm custard anyone?)- Bring your own alcoholic beverages.

YqJxcStp3pXgXQVHptfxmA.text: Yum!  I betrayed my beloved Poppies for an evening.  Had an old schoolmate in town and needed a fish and chips joint that was somewhat central.  Forward-ho to the Golden Hind which had stellar reviews and is notching one more from me!We were seated immediately, seating is tight, but not cramped.  Note to the drinkers, this place is BYOB.  Friend and I shared the fried feta cheese fritters.  I assumed it would be more than fried giant blocks of feta cheese, but nope... plain and simple... fried giant blocks of feta cheese.  I'm not going to complain; they're delicious.For the main event I went for the haddock and chips.  So good!  I will say that my fish was just the teensiest bit overdone, but still SO delicious.  The batter is super light, not at all overbearing, and I didn't get an oiliness at all!  For me the chips were just as much a star as the fish.  Finally!  Crunchy, crispy chips!  From start to finish!  These guys aren't stingy with the tartar sauce either, as they leave a giant bowl of it at your table for consumption.No mushy peas for me.  Peas are a "Nava poison," so I have to assume the others singing the praises of the mushy peas are quite right as everything else the Golden Hind had to offer was delicious!

nFfqSFD2KgHsq18lIZ0Csg.text: Best fish and chips I've had! I didn't want to wait for a table so I ordered take out. The order came out in about 10 minutes. Fab! I walked with my fingers digging into the fish and chip bag all the way to the movie theatre. It was so good! I didn't care I was making a mess on my fingers! LOL. It is cheaper to order it take out. I just wished I stopped to finish the rest of my fish and chips while they were still hot because once they were cold... it wasn't the same.

V2ald-ubc_BUhn6X5sWYSA.text: Amazing seriously delicious fish and chips !! It was a nice pub and the beer was really good. Service isn't like states so you have to order when they come or you will be waiting s long time

7y0186fXSfpcfnMnBIV3YQ.text: Great fish and chips! Good people and a great experience! Cute area to walk through with several pubs around the corner :) Enjoy!

pdfrnis67uNdiZ1Fwu-Xxg.text: We took a trip to London recently and found this place on "Hot on Yelp."  This place did not disappoint!  Fish and chips is a must when traveling to London and this was probably the best we have had - a perfect way to enjoy our first night in the city.  The menu had more than fish and chips but is (of course) better known for them.  They have different types of fish - like typical cod or haddock among others.  We ordered the cod and mushy peas.  Those mushy peas are amazingly good.  The food here is low in sodium.  There was not a sprinkle of salt on the fries (which we liked) and the fish was perfectly cooked.  The neighborhood was quaint and safe at night.  Would definitely go back.  Only negative: service is a bit slow as far as receiving check/money transaction.....otherwise extremely fast at getting food.

3A8otYqPc_wKZDvBd6dEzw.text: I had bad experience in having frozen fish and chips at some touristic pub so this trip, I did some research before I went to get fish and chips with my boyfriend who was first time in London, also first timer in fish and chips. This place had pretty good reviews from people so we decided to try.It was not touristy at all. Many local people were there and all they serve is fish and chips!You can choose Large cod or small cod, and also fried or steamed.We had fried of course because thats the typical way but thats nice that you can choose. I think small was enough for me, and large was enough for a guy. But anyways you get really full! I would go back again to this place if I had a chance. Its a shame its not so close to the metro but it is pretty nice area to walk around and feel the city.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

r9yh9s18uRMyVLyi3cCFMQ.text: Satisfied my fish and chip hankering while passing through London. Batter is crunchy. Chips are thick. Mushy peas are just right. The steamed fish alternative was equally delicious plus the healthy-eating points.Come early to beat the dinner crowd!

50hUgBMIjkVWG_WNsOTrwA.text: First I'll start with the good. The battered cod was of good quality. It would have been amazing if the batter had some flavor and it wasn't sitting in a puddle of oil on the plate. If the tartar sauce had flavor, it may have made up for the lackluster batter. The other place we had fish and chips had tartar sauce that tasted like nothing more than mayonnaise as well, so that may very well be the norm here. It was busy when we got there and we got the last available table, the place is so drab that you feel like the food must be amazing for it to be this crowded, which would have been fine if it were true. Our service was rude, and was not very helpful when we asked about portion sizes. He stuck his elbow in my face while opening our ginger beer and then shoved the can to me with the back of his hand. When he cleared my plate, he dropped trash he already had in his hand onto my plate before picking it up. I waited tables and tended bar for over a decade in the US where we survive on gratuity, so once again, I realize there is a cultural difference, but I would think people would be thrilled to wait on Americans if it means they will tip more than is the norm simply out of habit. The chips were cold, dry, and had no flavor whatsoever. The mushy peas while colorful, were lacking in the flavor department as well. I saw a lot of others going heavy on the salt shakers as well. For £30 total we have had far better food here with tons of flavor. In the US that entire meal would have cost us about half of what we paid here including a 20%tip, and would have come from a low quality chain restaurant. I would probably put this at the bottom of the list of places we've eaten at while in London.

7F6ovrCwLn1sfj2ijoCDZA.text: I had heard The Golden Hind was one of the best chippies in central London (i have been told by my British friends that the best ones are outside London) so I had to give it a try when I visited London.  They don't open till 11 am I think, and I arrived right on the mark.  Within minutes the place was busy with people.  I ordered a large cod and chips.  To be honest, I like fish when its either steamed, grilled, blackened...etc, but not usually fried (I don't like the taste of the batter).  Anyways, the fish was juicy and tender and the batter was not overpowering.  The chips could use a bit of work, but I soaked them in vinegar.The service was prompt and polite, which I haven't normally seen in London.Good, old place to get some fish n chips in London.

vnmZNXZkOiMtTdDUU_ucUg.text: I wrote some long diatribe about how the golden hinde had list it's magic but I must've been the  issue, not my dearest golden hinde.The owners are so nice, as are all the staff, and the fish and chips are as good as you'll find in central London, even more surprising, at a price even a tramp can afford.Their fish has a perfect crisp and the place itself is clean and in a nice area. People are nuts about that spot in waterloo but its dirty and filled with pensioners and life is too short to depress myself for fish.

W8AagvhRv2uPvQOtzc7pfg.text: This place was okay at best. Maybe I'm too American, but then again I'm Chinese, I know my seafood. I came here hoping to taste what "authentic" English Fish and Chips would be like. If this is what it taste like then I can definitely live without it. You won't hear me saying "You know what I'm craving? Some Fish and Chips"Yes there were a lot of selections of fishes, the food was fresh, but like one of the other Yelpers said the place stink of old grease...if you have no idea what I'm talking about, sniff the gunk buildup on your stove's hood filter...multiply that by 10.One thing I've noticed about UK's fish and chips is that they are always one huge fillet of the fish. I'm used to them being about 1/3 smaller and 2-3 piece per plate, the reason I mention this is that my the middle of the meal the bottom batter/shell of the fish got all soggy.It was a good experience, it really was better than the other places I went to in Central London. But like all the food I had there, these people need to season their food, It's like trying to review eating construction paper and premium paper....it's still bland! Food is about taste as well as freshness, presentation, etc. but in the end it needs flavor...or is it flavour?

zQ1_0jVLU_9bRLzEAuMvRg.text: Probably the only REAL British meal I had while in London, but I love fried foods so I think I made a good choice.  Portions are huge!  I felt like they gave me a whole fish!  But I ate all of it anyway because it was that good!  I have no idea how anyone can have side dishes AND dessert on top of the fish and chips.  I hate dining in restaurants by myself, but this place seemed to have a good number of solo diners on their lunch breaks, so I didn't feel so bad.Confirmation that I made the right choice in choosing this place for fish and chips: the friend I get all my food recommendations from also came here when he lived in London for a summer :)

P33YUmrebfE0NjTGAFNb2w.text: While fish and chips is not uncommon in London.  Just look at every pub sign, "Finest chips in London".  I found out the hard way that the picture on the sign did not always corroborate what was served.  But, "The Golden Hind" is the real deal.  It's BYOB which means no warm English pints or Pimms.  This place's primary concentration is serving fish and chips.  You have a variety of fishes that include the most popular and tasty Cod and Haddock.  Unfortunately, the place was sold out of the two most common choices but judging by the smiling faces of the folks we polled and which fish they were partaking in, the answer was universally Haddock.  We had to settle on the alternatives Plaice (a flat fish) and Rock Salmon while the other choices included Skate and a few more I can't recall.But the topper is the tartar sauce which is just describable as yummy.

l5F3qize_tHZCupkEtJJSA.text: My story is a testament to why The Golden Hind deserves a five-star rating without hesitation.I was unable to actually eat there even though I had already taken a seat because I was in a hurry and had to leave. They were kind enough to change my order to take out and charge me at take-out rate, which is slightly cheaper than the dine-in rate. They also gave me some of their self-made tartar sauce and some ketchup for my chips.Well, I couldn't eat the cod I had ordered for about an hour and fifteen minutes. I figured by the time I opened it up, the batter was going to be all soggy. But when I did open it, it was not soggy whatsoever. In fact, the only problem was that it was slightly colder (but that's to be expected). The fish was perfect, there's no way around it. The batter was excellent, but never outweighed the flavor of the fish. As well, the tartar sauce was probably the best I've ever had.The fact that I could eat my fish 75 minutes later without it being soggy truly indicates the Hind's quality.

q_GlfQ-QUdvbK-g0uQrW7g.text: Came here because of the rave and numerous yelp reviews and the fact that it is BYOB fish & chips place - BUT I have to say we were disappointed with the food.  The fish tasted as if it had been sitting under a heating lamp for a while and the chips were just OK.  Mushy peas were nice and different & fried feta was an interesting appetizer.  The queue moved quickly and once seated the service was friendly and attentive.  White Bear Pub remains the top fish & chips place on our trip!

NsHuEqMZ1jG9Jjv7AGjaBQ.text: GREAT Fish and Chips! My family used to have fish & chip shops in Scotland many years ago so I grew up preparing them, peeling potatoes, cutting fish, etc so I KNOW when it's good...these are GREAT! Good service, very clean (and that's hard to find!). Just off Marylebone High Street...you'll be glad you chose this place...

tMnR2c3wF2JE3i5dFnHDMA.text: Two years living in London and I've been on the hunt for the best fish'n'chips...I wish I had known that it was down the street!  The Golden Hind is definitely the top chippy in London.  The batter, the fish, the chips and the mushy peas...all get the highest marks!  The atmosphere is also great...mostly locals coming to eat their favourite fish'n'chips.  BYOB, so make sure to stop at the off license for a bottle or two.

xj7_ZD9NJisq-SqaWZnHiQ.text: Great little find, hadn't intended to have fish and chips and was surprised to hear the shop had been there for about 100yrs?!? (Regularly walk past there and never noticed it)Place was packed for a saturday evening but we were lucky to grab the last table on arrival. Decor is unremarkable but functional. Service was good and quick.We had three starters, breaded calamari,  garlic prawns and fried feta. The feta was a little bit heavy but all tasted good.The fiah and chips were both of good quality,  as with other London FnC shops the chips were a little bit sparse but overall a decent experience.

FZYn1KIFqTaQFV8uLue7iw.text: This place gets a solid 3 stars from me. It was completely packed the night I came, and my party of two waited 10-15 minutes for a table.  We got a corner spot that was so close to the next table, we literally had to move the other table whenever I got in or out.Food was good.  I ordered the haddock, which was a HUGE portion and came with a large side of chips.  The haddock was breaded and cooked to a perfectly crispy and crunchy consistency, while still maintaining the moist fish.  The chips were okay...crispy but not much flavor to them.  The same thing about the fish actually.  I recognize that it was a very well done piece of fish, but there was nothing there to excite me.  The flavor was exactly what you'd expect of a piece of fish deep fried in oil.The tartar sauce was creamy, a little too much so for my liking.  I prefer my tartar with a little tangy-ness, and that was lacking here.  Prices were cheap! I can't remember exactly how much, but very low for what I'd been spending all over the rest of London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

PJdnVzLe7GR8MECHkCoJXA.text: This place got great reviews on Yelp. And upon walking in (I had to be aggressive and push a guy out of the way with the door just to get in), I thought the restaurant had great promise. It was crowded and filled past fire marshal regulations (probably), but my friend and I got seated rather quickly.Service was great. People were nice. Though crowded to the point where my friend had to ask the table next to us to move their table over so she could get out to the bathroom, I didn't mind. I was just starving and wanted to get something into my body. Sure enough, the food came out promptly. I ordered the deep fried cod with chips. The cod was giant (about the size of half my arm) and fried to perfection. Though there's not much to complain about, there's also nothing too amazing about it. I guess I just realized from the meal that fried fish, is just fried fish to me.I wanted my fish n' chips experience in London, and I was definitely satisfied with the meal. However, nothing amazing to rave about. I guess a little more flavor in the batter would have been nice. Something like a little salt would have been nice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom

AXVY6tDkuKyb_g6Sx9JaTg.text: We walked 2 miles to eat the fish & chips!!!! It was well worth it!! The fish was crisp & so tender! I'm glad we made this our 1st dinner stop in London!! We ordered the calamari for appetizer it was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Golden Hind - London, United Kingdom. Best fish iv had!!

-5awPLulFfr22CgnviSlJA.text: Not what I expected.I had heard rave reviews from local friends, as well as on YELP and had high expectations when I arrived.  As someone else noted, this place is in a very posh neighborhood- that's the first thing you notice when you walk up.The next thing I noticed is that it was priced for the location, not the quality or amount of food offered.  The chips were a side order, not combined in cost.  A side of pickled onion (which was a half of a tennis ball sized white onion) was 60P alone.However, I was less concerned about cost as I was about taste.  Everything felt very under-seasoned.  The mushy peas, the chips and even the fish itself all lacked basics, like salt.  I kept trying to add vinegar to give me some flavor outside of the fry- which was actually quite nicely breaded and not too oily in the breading.  The fish was big and it was cooked well inside the breading, not too dry, not too flaky.  The chips were not crisp on the outside and were a bit mushy- like the peas- on the inside.  If you are into that- then they are great.Overall- this place is pretty good- but I don't think it was worth me going so far out of my way to come try.

owLHIytW66UITcn7rK8Yfg.text: Best Fish&Chips in town! Very basic and highly authentic. BYOB place. The food is excellent and massive. Huge portions for reasonable prices. Be prepared to queue for a wile. You may start with the wine you bring along

6aI5oub9JLGNSEQGtxXkxg.text: My favorite go to fish and chips shop in London. It's ironic that this humble establishment, which serves what many would consider plebeian food, is located just down the street from the celebrated Wigmore Hall and the outstanding Wallace Collection--two of my old haunts in one of the swankiest parts of the city. I've tried quite a few around the city. I was even armed with a top rated list from numerous London food writers and tried them out one by one but gave up after a while for obvious reasons! Time and time again I ended up here because it's so good. The restaurant is plain in decor and unpretentious but with the friendliest service from the owner down to the waitstaff. I love the fried haddock with chips and mushy peas. Cod is my second preference. If you're in London and in the mood for the freshest fried fish this is it! However, don't be deterred by the line waiting to get in. It's totally worth the time and trouble.

R7-mlGgpGhA9ZFf3Uaj9gw.text: To put in bluntly, the food is London SUCKS. This was the best meal we've had in London by far.TOURISTS, DON'T BE FOOLED! You don't need to leave an additional tip. They will try and trick with you the "service not included "signs. We left a tip but lingered and realized no one else did. Clearly, everyone else was a local.

J6CTOR7eZP0g6w76_HvOsA.text: Went here as we were staying locally and just HAD to have fish, chips and mushy peas during our stay. Not much ambiance but they were friendly and a happy crowd was eating dinner. No liquor but there's a local pub and store to BYOB. Cod was good; chips passable and peas were great! Unfortunately my companion got sick that night. From the food? Not sure but it was the only thing he ate that I didn't (haddock) all day and we weren't drinking.  Next time we will try somewhere else for my fix.

WIp1vLqZDSnS51EvV0JnHQ.text: I live two doors down from here. Love this restaurant. Probably top 3 fish n chips spot in London. You can get your fish steamed if u prefer - just as tasty.

tOYydyVLQ6tR_cV54PLSMw.text: The best fish and chips in London? Let me tell you what I think about this restaurant. I ordered large portion of fried cod version of their fish and chips. I'm not crazy about fried stuff, but when it comes to fish and chips, I just had to try it.I was really surprised by the variety of fish they served too.  You can choose fried or steamed haddock, cod fishcakes, dogfish, skate and halibut.  Most fish and chips restaurants in North America only have two varieties of fish such as cod or halibut.Initalliy, I wanted to like the cod because there wasn't a big thick layer of batter covering the fish. It was nicely seasoned, but the fish was most likely over fried so it was dry like overcooked French fries which came with my dish. The mushy peas which came with the dish was like eating green peas version of mashed potatoes. I like my fried cod to be a bit juicy with fish oils when sliced with a knife and it just didn't happen at The Golden Hind. Dry tasting fried fish doesn't do it for me.

ed5C2JZrueH3e-A0KUMf-A.text: Not bad fish & chips...minus the hair.The best fish & chips I ever had was from some chippy in Penzance, and I wanted to get some in London before heading home. Based on the Yelp reviews, that took me to The Golden Hind.It's a good walk north on Marylebone Lane from Bond St station. The place had a few customers, and the employees all seemed to be Russian. I ordered haddock & chips for takeaway, and that came to £6. The food was in my hands perhaps 10 minutes later.Obviously it was a mistake to order takeaway. I knew that there was a square nearby, and I hoped to enjoy my meal on a bench there, but, as is remarkably often the case in London, the gate was locked. I walked several blocks and came across three more squares, only to find that they were all locked. Sure that, now 15 minutes later, my meal was going to soon be stone cold and the fish mush, I ate on the pedestal of some fountain.I was pleased to see that they provided malt vinegar in my bag, and it all smelled very good. But then I pulled away the oil-soaked paper to reveal a disgusting, wavy black hair on the edge of my tray, laying right next to my chips. Well, I was hungry and had walked quite far enough, so I bravely tossed it aside and dug in. Of course, had I been eating in, I surely would have complained. The fish was okay, although it needed salt. Sadly, the chips were rather mushy. Certainly nothing like what you can get in the southwest of England, but, if you do go, check for hair before walking out the door!

cdlEp31yz73jlUHSz7phuw.text: This is how fish n chips is created, the proper way. Light batter, thick, juicy fillet of cod, and not oily at all! The one in US is very thin, so this thick, big and long fish is perfect! Its not salty at all, so you may want to season it yourself if you like strong taste. The garlic butter shrimp is just so so. Met Tony the owner, vey nice gentleman. He said you have to have the perfect batter, good quality fish and good oil to make perfect fish n chips! An older lady said you gotta try this restaurant, its the best and ive eaten here for 30 years. Its super!

tzgfiQ6IqPAvYrg3I8VjQQ.text: Get there right when they open to avoid a crazy wait.  Definitely BYOB or W from the nice wine shop around the corner.Straight-up, simple menu executed well.  No frills.Located in a really cool, charming neighborhood filled with pubs/cafes/retail shops, relatively tourist-free.  (I said relatively.  It's still London.)

t4QNj0DK87LMNLZ-BpssGQ.text: Wonderful service and perfectly fried fish. A simple and affordable option in an expensive, trendy neighbourhood. A nice informal date night.

Tha_z6cEA8LJJ-d5a3TLJQ.text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet.  Crispy fish and chips - enjoy it with the mushy peas.  The fried fresh cod cakes to start were delicious as well.  We were too stuffed for dessert as we also shared a salad.  The owner is friendly and works the room.  If you hesitate going to a proper chip shop - this is your place.  Bring Your Own Wine to dine.

npCWOfTI6mYwU_byW4pG0w.text: This was recommended by one of our local executives who works around the corner and it did not disappoint.  I generally don't care much for deep fried food but if you are going to eat fried fish this is the place to go.  It was not greasy or dripping with oil (like most places) and the batter just flakes right off.  The staff is great and provides quick service.  I don't normally eat french fries (err chips) but they were good too - again not greasy at all.  Did I mention the portions were huge?!  Very convenient to Oxford Street and all the hotels near Marble Arch.  The only downside were the lines on Friday night, but that's a sure sign of popularity.  Highly recommend - I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

PW84UbmcajzXX7-kYjWYhg.text: FOOD:yummy fish n chips selection of fish too. so soft succulent inside yet perfectly fried n crispy outside ... *drool .. First time having mashed peas too. Felt like a gerber baby again. lol. But I guess it's a thing to eat mashed peas with fish n chips.. When in rome.. SERVICE:GoodATMOSPHERE:casual

ViM6hHkFVYO78tacl35etA.text: fish cake is a must try.fish and chip is good but beware of the type of fish you order because some are a bit more fishy then othersvery friendly and fast service.
